Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dashing4u
Reviews.Content: This was booked for a conference at Harvard University. From the moment I booked, everything went smoothly. I secured a good rate by booking well in advance of my stay, and had a nice smart room on the 10th floor, with working desk space, and a couch, but my bathroom only had a shower, no bath. Internet best value if you pay for the length of your stay in your room. The staff were very friendly, and helpful. Restaurant was great for breakfast but rather limited for other meals, although good quality. Bit on the pricey side for casual dining. Close to many other eateries but no fast food thank goodness. Also close to the "T" so take the Silver Line across the road from the hotel to South Station (via tram) and then hop on the train, if you want to go to Harvard Square, or Boylston area (for the Apple Store). Only one ticket needed using the Charlie ticket system which is more economical, otherwise exact change required as you board. Great views over the water and super close to the airport. An excellent find and strongly recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dickyhell
Reviews.Content: My second stay, excellent attitude the short time i was there, Good room, good service,nice pool, a short taxi ride to the centre of Boston. This is my preffered hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in hot Boston location”
Reviews.Author: wendy51998
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was easy enough to walk to other areas during the day. We went to del friscos for dinner which was right across the street! Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, view was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Water Views and location”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here to attend the annual New England Boat show and were very happy with both the location and the views. We were on the 21st floor and our room was bright, sunny and offered wonderful views of the harbor. It was a quick 5 minute walk to the convention center, which made it easy. While we didn't eat there, there is a Del Frisco's right there (one of my favorite steakhouses). The staff was friendly and helfpul. I would stay here over the Seaport if the rates were the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great....but...”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location across from some great restauarants, including the one in the hotel. Lobby is beautiful and one of the nicest I have experienced. Gym is also one of the best I've seen in a hotel. The problem with this hotel, and it is a big one, is lack of sound proofing in rooms. Even at a normal voice tone, you can clearly hear everything that is being said in the room next to you. I have experienced this on all 3 occassions that I have stayed at this hotel. Service at front desk is excellent by the way. Bathrooms are great and rooms are spacious and sunny with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is way too expensive; walls too thin”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here in February 2012. The location is excellent. I-93 is just a short drive away and there is a T station a little less than a block away. There are a few great restaurants in the neighborhood. My biggest issues were the parking - which was too expensive (Valet & on-site self parking is an outrageous $42/day) and the paper-thin walls between rooms. I learned a lot about my neighbor and his business even though he wasn't trying to be loud. The concierge lounge was nice and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dlars25533
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the boston wine expo in january and agreed it woudld be best to stay in town. We stayed at the Renaissance on the waterfront. As usuall a great mariott experience. The rooms have recently been done over and are brigght and colorful. Our room overlooked the boston harbor and was a great view. The lobbey is pretty large and the hotel bar and lounge are right off the lobbey. There is valet parking. There are also many new restaurants around the hotel as well as about a 20 minute walk to the Quincy Market and other waterfont attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, great service and excellent sleeping atmosphere. Lovely location just off the water with great restaurants with in walking distance. Also a great restaurant located right in the lobby was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel that thinks its spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Maine729
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a convention in Boston held at the Boston Convention & Exhibition Center. We could have selected from three hotels associated with the convention - we selected the Renaissance but won't select it next year when the convention returns to Boston. I should have read reviews of this hotel before booking it. I completely agree that this hotel charges for everything including WiFi, parking ($42 a day) and bottles of water. The rooms are adequate but nothing special. Vehicle parking must be done by valets unless you learn how to go completely around the hotel (avoidig myriad one way streets) and discover the underground parking garage entrance. We're stayed here in the past and, frankly, wouldn't have stayed this time but all three hotels associated with the NCEC are so similiar we couldn't remember which one we'd stayed at and enjoyed. It wasn't this one.

Reviews.Title: “NYE Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: Tom N
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the view of the Boston harbor for New Years Eve fireworks. It is in a district next to downtown called the Seaport district that has several nice restaurants in the area such as Legal Harborside. The hotel itself is new, has nice decor with service/amenities that you'd expect from this large chain. The location is close to downtown but a not necessarily a short walk from the downtown sites. From the Public Garden, we had to take the Red line to Silver line to get there or hire a cab for a ride. A plus to the non-downtown location is that parking near the hotel is a ton cheaper per day than any lot right downtown. We did have issues with noise. There was a party going on next door and I had to go down to the lobby twice (11pm and 2am) to get resolved. The walls seem a bit thin to deal with even the alarm radio playing next door much less a party, Yes it was New Years Eve and there's no way the hotel could stop all of the noise because I'm sure many others had the same idea as us to stay overlooking the water.

Reviews.Title: “$4 to bring up 2 forks....just ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: HippyHopper
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: First Reniassance I have gone to in the US, after a couple very pleasant and rather luxurious experiences in China. I'm not sure how their branding is positioned here or what should I expect from them. This is a very nice, comfortable and clean hotel. Views of Boston are fantastic from the upper floors. Our room was spacious. Excellent location if you need to go to the Convention Center, and not terribly out of the way if you want to tour Boston. It's a matter of context, if you come from a big city, given the compact nature of Boston's downtown and historic neighborhoods everything will seem relatively handy. I had this incident one night, however. My wife and I had leftovers from lunch at a nearby restaurant and we hate to throw food away, and I had just bought some excellent fruit at Haymarket to round a little dinner in the room up. I called to have a couple forks brought to the room, and much to my surprise I was asked if I had ordered room service. I candidly explained what was going on with my "dinner arrangements", to which I was told that it would be a $4 fee. Are you kidding me? Had we needed knives it would have been $8? Totally unnecessary disappointment. I'm still scratching my head on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with 5star prices where every little thing costs extra!”
Reviews.Author: us3345632
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan for several days the room was very average -- nothing special. A view staring into the windows of a condo complex across the street. Shades had to be drawn the entire time. No bath, just shower. Nice and large LCD tv. Water bottles were $4 each - usually you get 2 complimentary at other hotels. The business center -- 2 computers working (3 in all); very cramped and next to a noisy conference room, difficult to get any work done. Many people tried to walk in but all computers were taken. Wifi is available in the room BUT for an additional 16-20$ per day depending on if you want fast or slow WiFi. Found myself wondering if this should really cost extra with such a sub par business center. The breakfast - not cheap --- $22 per person for buffet, though it was very tasty. There is a continental version for $16 as an alternative or a Starbucks which is the cheapest option. Due to the location, not many breakfast alternatives. Fitness center: pretty good -- free weights and several machines as well as a lot of aerobic equipment. Good for a hotel. Service and staff was excellent. Very friendly. Overall I thought this hotel was a B/B-; I didn't like all the extra fees which don't exist in many other chains, made me feel like a piÃ±ata, not a guest. Location could be better as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mssnash
Reviews.Content: Very convenient if you are attending a conference.. about 4 blocks or so away from the convention center. Hotel room has mini refrigerator and nice view. Nice restaurants nearby. Overall quite nice, one thing to mention is that the concierge was worthless.

Reviews.Title: “New, Comfortable, Clean, but a Bit Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: The_Firestones
Reviews.Content: It is in a part of Boston that is undergoing a lot of urban renewal. The area was formally just large empty parking lots adjacent to the World Trade Center and a couple of restaurants that overlook Boston Harbor. Now there are 3 new hotels, including this one, several new restaurants including the test kitchen for Legal Seafood, and a couple of condominiums. So you'll either have to drive or take a cab to get to downtown where the real fun and attractions are. Attended a party a block away and stayed over here for New Year's Eve. The place was packed and when we arrived the valet said the could not park any cars because the garage was full. You would think that every room would have a guaranteed parking spot, but I guess they don't think their guests are that important and a buck is a buck. They told me there were a couple of open air parking lots a couple of blocks away or if I was lucky I might find a meter that was free. They did let me unload and belongings up to the room. I talked to the manager and he apologized for the inconvenience. When got back to the room there was a demi bottle of wine, some cheese and crackers, which was a nice touch. The room was nicely appointed as you would expect from a Renaissance and had a good view over the harbor and downtown. I tried to extend checkout, but was told that 12 was it. When I told them I was a Platinum member they said the could give me 30 extra minutes. Typically I'd get 2-3 hours extended, but not here.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: rwhatzo
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights before Christmas celebrating my birthday in Boston. I asked for a room on a high floor away from the elevator and got an exceptional room with a great view of Boston and the harbor. The room was well maintained and designed, the bathroom had a glass enclosed shower instead of a tub and shower curtain. The front desk staff was very friendly and so were the staff in the lounge and restaurant. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants with harbor views and within walking distance of two MBTA Silver Line Stations. The Institute of Conemporary Art is just a short walk away. We left our car with the valet for $42 a night but next time will park in one of the very close parking lots that charge only $30. We had a very good breakfast at "606" the in house restaurant, it was priced like most hotels but I did find that $4 for a cup of coffee was rather high. My companion liked it so much that she suggested we go back this summer when we can walk along the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeanH1999
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The staff is exceptional and very willing to help. It is a short walk to the center of Boston. Restaurant is fair but overpriced. Rooms are spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Johnvb87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a few days while visiting friends in the Boston area. We arrived via airplane and took the Silver Line from the airport to the hotel since we wouldn't be needing a car for the first two days we were there. The World Trade Center stop on the Silver Line is just one block from the hotel, so that was very convenient. (I believe the Silver Line Way stop is also one block away, in the other direction). Check in at the front desk was a breeze! They gave us a corner room, which was a little more spacious than the standard rooms. The room was very nice. It had a king bed, sofa, desk and tv. We didn't need to access the internet while we were there, but I believe it was around $13 per day. We did get rent a car the second day we were there (since we were visiting friends outside the realm of the MBTA transportation network). The only downside to that was the parking at the hotel was $42 per night (although the valet was very convenient). We did a trolley tour while we were there. The trolley stopped less than 100 yards from the hotel. The only reason I couldn't rate this hotel with 5 stars was that while we were there the hotel pool was temporarily closed for some reason so we weren't able to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Not waterfront, but very close.”
Reviews.Author: iosilver
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for a Boston hotel that is relatively new (one year old?). The room, on the 20th floor, was comfortably furnished and had a great view of the harbor and the city. South Station and Quincy Market were a short taxi ride away or walkable, weather permitting. The staff were congenial, helpful, and responsive to the one complaint we had about their putting us in a room in a lower floor than we had expected. The lounge downstairs was pleasant and had a nice buzz. Coffee addicts can get their fix at an adjoining Starbucks. If you have AARP or AAA, you can likely get a 5% reduction in the room rate. Check out the exercise/pool/spa on the 5th floor - very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Up-and-Coming Area”
Reviews.Author: MichelleD_31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in April and was overall pleased with my stay. We did have a very delayed check-in process (two of the front desk clerks simply walked away leaving only one person left to man the line of no less than 15 people checking in), but will assume that is not a common occurrence. The service we received during our stay by the employees we interacted with was all positive and appropriate. The rooms are decorated in a nautical theme and were well appointed. The bathroom was fantastic with cool subway tiles and a large glass encased shower. I found the size of the room to be a bit larger than what I normally see in the city. There is also a very nice bar/restaurant in the lobby. We had a cocktail one night before heading upstairs and enjoyed the scene. Some other reviews mentioned hearing noise from neighboring guest rooms. I am usually very attuned to this and thankfully did not have that experience at this hotel. The area is definitely growing as it used to be completely barren of any life. There are now many restaurants, etc. to enjoy and it's a great location on the harbor. I'm actually looking forward to going back next Summer to enjoy the ample outdoor venues in the nicer weather. However, if you are seeking the Boston hub experience, I might recommend staying in the Back-Bay or Quincy Market area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: calilove16
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Boston and we wanted to stay someplace in the city where we could walk to everything. This Renaissance is a gorgeous hotel, with a Starbucks, restaurant, bar, room service, etc. We were able to check in at 9:30am which was AWESOME! The only complaint I have is that our room was in the corner next to the linen closet that the housekeepers kept slamming the door and making a lot of noise. I also wouldn't stay here again if I was looking to walk everywhere, it was a little far to get to Back Bay and Beacon Hill, it is in great walking distance from Downtown though. If I don't care about walking and I plan on taking cabs then I would definitely stay here again, it's quiet and a beautiful, clean hotel. One of the better Marriott Hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “It's nothing special and there is nothing near by so plan on a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: nurabbit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. The rooms are nothing special and having to pay for internet in the rooms is annoying. We used the Starbucks free wifi in the lobby! We had a water view but had to look over buildings,etc to see it. As mentioned in another review, the walls are very thin so we heard a baby on one side and a couple who seemed to argue a lot on the other side. The Starbucks in the lobby is great. The room service food was decent. The staff seemed very nice and eager to please. The area is not great for sightseeing. If you are there for a convention, it is probably an OK hotel but if you want to see anything in Boston, it's not a good location. It IS a very short distance from the airport which is nice, but we ended up taking cabs everywhere else we wanted to go. It's not the location for enjoying the sights of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A conference experience like no other.”
Reviews.Author: douginmaine04104
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in this beautiful hotel. Food was outstanding. Cocktail Lounge was welcoming and warm on a very cold and rainy October night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Ok location depending on the purpose of trip.”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: The Seaport is attempting to become the place to be in Boston, but not succeeding much. This is where this hotel is located. One of many in the immediate vicinity of the Boston Convention Center. The area is still plagued with empty lots and parking garages. You are a stone throw away from the water, but it is barely accessible.. The shipyard is there. Lots of new restaurants are close buy. Legal Harborside and a couple of others in the same building are the latest addition but not worth it! The excellent Sam's @ Louis Boston is less than a mile away. Forget about Anthony's Pier 4 and no name. Pretentious is VERY overpriced. So when it comes to location, if you have to be @ the Convention Center pick this place if not stick to downtown Boston or the Back Bay. The hotel itself is nice and modern. Nice staff, lobby is beautiful. The rooms are large and very clean with modern TV and nice linen. Aveda bath products are provided in cheap quantities. Not much of a view from the rooms. The WALLS are VERY THIN. I could hear all night the TV of the neighbor.. Torture!! The gym is decent with few machines and treadmills. There is a 2 lane lap pool (probably 12.5meters) and a nice Spa facility and Sauna. Parking is by valet. 30$!!! hard to park on your own and then it's a small walk. Overall, again if you are on a business trip or need to be close to the Convention, go there, if not there are a lot of better located places in Boston. The seaport district is not ready for prime time and probably would need another 10-15 years to become.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: doctorfoxtrot
Reviews.Content: stayed 5nights in this hotel to attend a convention... 1. Location - 5 min ride from airport.. a casual 5-10 min walk to conv ctr , 5 min walk to a 7-11 store , multiple restaurants outside... a 20 min walk to city centre , quincy hall , advisable to instead take a cab .. 2. Lobby , small quaint luxurious ...3. Rooms , quite small but functional , beds comfortable, with good lighting , bathroom adequate but no separate shower , huge Lcd Tv , airconditioning has good temperature control ...4. Staff .. very polite and professional in approach , from the front desk , bell staff , concierge, what they call the 'navigator' , housekeeping personnel ....5. Restaurant, the 606 congress , only one in the hotel , is where i had my daily buffet breakfast , providing extensive choices, fair enough , which serves good food, i also had dinner once , and i would say that the staff are quite polite and friendly ...6. Internet ..free in our room.. they provided us with a password, included in my package .., internet free in the lobby where a desktop computer can be found.. 6. Business center , indoor pool and health spa accessible with a card key and open 24 hrs ..7. starbucks , yes.. there is one beside the lobby .... overall very much satisfied with this 4-5 star hotel quality most especially giving comfort in the midst of a winter storm during that time

Reviews.Title: “I expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: Alana33
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront Hotel and my expectations were pretty high when a friend of mine who lives in the Boston area referred to it as a upscale hotel. It wasn't. It was an average hotel in my opinion. The rooms were a fairly good size and the front desk staff was very good. I decided at the last minute to change my flight to leave after staying only one night instead of two about 1 hour after the check out time. The front desk didn't even mention that I was late for check-out and checked me out without a problem. The lobby bar with the live entertainment on Friday night was a very nice touch. If you are looking for a comfortable mid class hotel near the convention center and airport, this is a very good choice. If you are looking for more luxury, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and luxurious rooms, so so location”
Reviews.Author: cyndilou
Reviews.Content: We stay here overnight with a voucher from our credit card company so it was essentially free. That being said we did think the room was a great value. The room was spacious and very clean. The lobby bar was very cool and there was a Starbucks attached. The buffet breakfast was awesome! my only complaint is that the location on the waterfront meant we had to take cabs into Back Bay but the value was worth that inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirl2020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is close to the airport and some new restaurants on the water. The hotel itself is modern and clean and service is great. The lobby bar had lots of seating and good drinks, but bar entertainment was HORRIBLE, I would have been happier listening to elevator music than to a band still using their guitar training wheels. Parking was also a project, it's either valet or a garage a few blocks away. It would be nice if there was an elevator from the garage that went right to the hotel. The hotel is also freezing in many areas- the bar, lobby, meeting rooms- bring an extra sweater. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emelleme
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a conference, and the experience was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location remote”
Reviews.Author: hamishmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention. The hotel was very nice with good employees, but if I was on a non-business trip, I wouldn't stay here because of the distance from the city. There are quite a few nice restaurants nearby and you can walk easily to the Silver T line (which will take you to the airport for $2).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, contemporary property -- like new!”
Reviews.Author: Hillgirl8024
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely, comfortable hotel, with a fantastic fitness center and excellent service. 5-7 minute walk to the convention center. Besides in-house or Boston restaurant didning, there is a deli/convenience store a block away (ask concierge) which has everything you could need, and refrigerators in the rooms. Room was always cleaned promtly and thoroughly and staff was friendly and professional. Highy recommend.

Reviews.Title: “restuarant the best in this neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: feather_7
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from the information on the Boston's ferry service website. As we planned to take the ferry to Provincetown on Monday. We arrived on late on Saturday, the front desk clerk told us we had a city view, was fine with us. If we looked the other direction could see the water also. We asked about restuarants in the area. Said the hotel restuarant was very good. We did not at that time take her advice. We should have. Walked to the waterfront a couple of blocks. My friend wanted to eat facing the water. Ate at Legal Harborside ,I could not get a decent meal have many food allergies. She had a meal. Then we came back to the hotel after walking around the area. We than went into the hotel's restuarant where the Chef prepared me a Gluten Free meal. The meal was so good that we continued to eat here the rest of the weekend. Also when we returned a week later ate here before going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Super stylish, comfortable, fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: honeoyefallsmb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance in the new seaport area of Boston. The whole area is new and very upscale, if lacking in the personality you expect of a visit to Boston. The hotel was very comfortable, attractive and the staff was just great. The new ICA is steps away, as is the new convention center. A 15 minute walk will take you to Quincy Market. The new subway line hooks you to the great public transportation in this city. Parking was expensive, but that's Boston. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location from Airport and Convenient to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountainSteve
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great features, updated, close to decent dining although it's not close in to downtown. However, a short $10 taxi ride puts you right in the heart of the city and the historic landmarks. The nice thing about this hotel is its proximity to Logan International. I would definitey recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Typical Upscale Corporate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCalRR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of the newer large business hotels: Nice rooms with modern technology, and a small lobby with a single expensive restaurant, a bar, and the requisite Starbucks which is open during the daylight hours. I found the staff to be very friendly.The rooms are good sized, very clean, with comfy beds and bathroom amenities that will leave your hair smelling minty fresh, literally. Request a room on an an upper floor for an amazing view of Boston Harbor, with either the city skyline or Logan Airport as the backdrop. The hotel also has a small gym with new equipment, including free weights, and a narrow indoor lap pool. The gym is free, but there is a charge for WiFi. The self-service business center is also free to use. I arrived from the airport at 7:30am expecting to just drop off my bags before heading into town, and they checked right into a room. The hotel seems to be in a redevelopment area of Boston that ran out of steam when the economy turned sour. The area has a couple of hotels, a few sit down restaurants, the convention center, and a couple of office buildings, but not much else. Very few people live in the immediate vicinity, so the area is pretty dead at night and on weekends. It almost seems like a suburban "corporate office park" near the water. Nearly everyone visiting the area appears to be attending a conference of some sort. It's only about a 15 minute walk into downtown, but along most of the walk you'll be passing wide open parking lots surrounded by chain-link fences or fishing piers. On the plus side, the subway in Boston is very easy to use, and the Silver Line station is less than a short city block away. The hotel is also only a 5 minute ride from the airport. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I was travelling on business, but I think I would rather stay in Downtown Boston if I was travelling for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Bleak Location”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Relatively new Renaissance, everything fresh, clean and modern. Room was quiet and comfortable, staff was efficient and friendly. The biggest negative is there is literally nothing in the immediate area within walking distance for restaurants, shops, etc. Need to either take a cab or the Silver Line T which stops a half block from the hotel and runs up to South Station. I was only there one night so it wasn't a huge problem but I certainly wouldn't want to be in this location for a longer stay. As a result of the isolation, I did have dinner in the hotel restaurant, which I found surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: MaineMan2Maine
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights for a wedding that next door at the Seaport(which is a beautiful hotel). Room was clean, appeared to be an older hotel with renovations. Close to convention hall but look elsewhere if you want to get around and walk to a lot of Boston sites. Wife locked herself out of the room, took over 30 minutes and they were not going to let her in. Her ID was in the room, let her in and check the ID. Wouldn't stay again unless it was for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Upcoming area near the convention center; plenty to do!”
Reviews.Author: familygoBoston
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Boston Waterfront Hotel My husband and I recently stayed here to celebrate our 24th anniversary. We live 20 minutes away, but wanted to use our Marriott points for a "staycation". The weekend rate for this hotel was on the high side, but not for Boston. Location: We found this to be a great location for exploring an area of Boston that is "up and coming"- the Seaport. The convention center and exhibition center anchor this area, and the hotels and other attractions are in between. There is a Silver Line T station here too, so arriving from the airport would be easy, but getting to the other areas of Boston would require a few changes. This area and hotel is really designed for conventions, but the locals have found the Institute for Contemporary Art, the lively bars (Whiskey Priest ) and the restaurants (Strega on the waterfront, Legals on the waterfront) and it was a very lively place on a Saturday night. Its a young crowd, as there are many college students and young professionals in Boston. It feels very empty during other times if there is no convention, because the infrastructure is built to accommodate huge convention groups. There was enough to do within walking distance of this area to keep us busy for a weekend. We also enjoyed all the pocket parks and urban art installed in the area as we wandered. Clearly, the area could use a few more shops, but the galleries and artisans have found the area, and hopefully can afford to stay. We never felt unsafe or that the area was risky in any way. Of course you have to use your city savvy in any large city, but overall, we never saw anything or anyone that felt threatening in this area. Theme: This hotel is a Marriott brand. We found it to be of modern design, much like any of the Renaissance brand. There was nothing about the hotel that was specifically themed to Boston. Room: Like the hotel, we found the room to be clean, modern, spacious but nondescript. Also our King was decorated with neutral stripes on the wall and a very large colorful couch. but it was missing any kind of chair in the sitting area. It was if they had just removed the "other queen" and the room had a blank spot where that bed should have been! The room had a fridge, a coffee bar, and was set up to "wire" up easily with plugs and connections right on the desk top. Service: We didn't need much aside from valet parking and check in; all of which was efficient and polite. Things to do in the area: This area is "up and coming", and it's been discovered by locals if not tourists yet. There are several branches of excellent local restaurants in the area, such as Strega (on the water front) and Legal Seafood (3 levels each offering something different) as well as Anthony's Pier 4, an old favorite. A couple of more casual eateries such as Remy's Sports Bar and the very popular Whiskey Priest bar on the water front, lines out the door by 8:30 PM (as we were headed back to retire, LOL!) Art and culture your thing? the New ICA (Institute for Contemporary Art) is an excellent addition to the city with in walking distance, in addition to the terrific art inside, the view outside is pretty amazing too! Additionally, we enjoyed many of the outdoor art installations in and around the convention and exhibition centers and at the MBTA station! Yes, a very dramatic sculpture of 4 horseman dedicated to the Polish resistance during WWII. We also enjoyed an interesting exhibit offered nearby (a few blocks off the waterfront) at the Grand Circle company's home office. They have a lovely "free!" art exhibit area, which featured the Washburn's photos (one of the longtime trustee and founder of the Museum of Science) and vintage travel posters and artifacts, as well as a comfy living room like area where guests are welcome to relax, check email and learn more about Grand Circle travel (if you want, no pressure) What a surprise that was! Right across the street was the Boston Fire Museum, we didn't visit, but just peeked. Another freebie (donations accepted) and it looked like a blast for the kids with turnout gear to try, a pole, and the bell (clang, clang, clang!) and real firefighter to answer questions. In the same neighborhood, look for Flour, and incredible bakery that offered indoor and outdoor seating, and yummy baked goods and fresh sandwiches of every type! taht was plenty enough for us in a 24 hour visit, but there would be more if you wanted for instance: harbor cruises debark out of this area too!

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Choice Near the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: JLTP
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights while attending a conference at the convention center located a short 5-7 minute walk away. My room was relatively spacious and appeared to be near-new as was the entire property. I didn't spend much time at the hotel, but the service people I encountered were business-like and professional. As compared to many of the other hotels in the vicinity of the convention center, this one was a bit less frenzied. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Clean Rooms - Level of Service Not Special”
Reviews.Author: jimengel
Reviews.Content: The guestrooms at the Renaissance are certainly welcoming, up to date and spacious. The staff was not rude or mean in any way but the "heads down" concierge looking at their computer when no guests are there instead of greeting you; the clerks standing visiting when you pass instead of greeting you - illustrates an average level of service in a HIGH level of Service PRICE POINT. Had a fire alarm (false) at 9pm during stay and alarms were so shrilling loud it hurt your ears. I called the operator after 10 minutes (I was in the shower) to see if I needed to evacuate still. She said they were not sure what floors needed to evacuate. huh? that should have been clear in 15 seconds. So I evacuated - only to get the alarm tripping again on my way down saying all clear - again so loud it hurt my ear drums - I mean my ears were ringing from it. At least no one will EVER sleep through a fire alarm at this hotel! Biggest reason I will not return is that on top of very high room rates per night they want to charge you $18.00 a night for WIFI from your guestroom. That is an unreasonable charge with their room rate and in these times. If your doing business here, you only get free WIFI if you sit in their small lobby. ASK them if it is free when booking, maybe you will help persuade them to change! Within walking distance to their Beautiful Convention Center! Cabs always readily available. Friendly bellman.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for Business Travel/Probably Less Appealing for Vacationing”
Reviews.Author: JackieKerouac
Reviews.Content: I attended a three-day conference that was taking place at this hotel, and so, I stayed there as well. I'd say it's a great place for business travel, but I would consider it less appealing for vacationing as it's a fair distance from Boston's typical main attractions and historical center. Most of the guests at the hotel seemed to be there on business. I know that there was at least one other conference also taking place at the hotel. As I walked around the area, both during the day and in the evening, most of the people that I saw were in suits. As a business traveler, the proximity to the airport was ideal. You really couldn't get any closer. It was just across the water, and I could watch the planes taking off from my room. I was on the top floor (21) facing the water and part of the airport, and based on conversations with other guests, it sounds as if I had one of the best views the hotel offers, which was just so-so. In addition to the airport and a slice of the water, I could see parking lots filled with industrial shipping vehicles and a couple new luxury buildings. I found my room to be a little on the small side, but it was clean and well maintained. The room decor was subtly nautical, without being over the top. The lobby of the hotel is sleek, urban, and modern--although it felt as if the decorators were trying a little too hard (I mean...a fake tree in the center of the revolving door?). The staff was very attentive, polite and helpful. I would venture to say that it was some of the best service I've ever received at a hotel. The only real downside for me was the room service. I ordered dinner on one evening, and while the food was good, it arrived cold. I never ate at the actual hotel restaurant on the main floor because there were a handful of other options a half block away. If you're looking for a delicious dinner during your stay, I would highly recommend Temazcal Cantina, which is just around the corner. It was the highlight of the trip. It's an upscale Mexican restaurant with a diverse menu of impressive and inventive dishes and a large array of cocktails. All three of the people with whom I dined were very, very happy with it as well. If you do have some extra time on your hands, the hotel is a 10-minute walk to the Boston Institute of Contemporary Art. One of my conference's evening networking events was held there, but unfortunately, I didn't have the opportunity to see any of the art because we were in an event space separate from the galleries. The next closest attraction is probably the Boston Aquarium, which is a good 20-minute walk. I attended a reception there and enjoyed the penguins, various types of sharks, the enormous sea turtle, giant rays, blowfish, etc. It's an interesting place with an unusual design (a spiral ramp takes you around an enormous tube-shaped tank, allowing you to get incredibly close to the sea life). All in all, I recommend this hotel for business travelers and anyone looking to be close to the airport. If your priority is tourism, you'll probably be happier if you stay in an area closer to the action and/or the historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: phillytraveler71
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a conference held at the hotel. The hotel is brand new with nice rooms, comfortable beds and an awesome fitness center (including a lap pool, which I used twice). The conference facilities (rooms, wifi paid for by our conference and food) were quite good, contributing to a strong overall conference. I ate at the restaurant three times (2 breakfasts, 1 lunch) and had drinks at the bar a few times. In all instances, I had attentive and thoughtful servers who went the extra mile, which is not something I usually experience at Marriott properties. I stayed an extra two days to sightsee in Boston. With the conference rate, this was an excellent deal and better than any I could find for the weekend otherwise. The location is close to the water and a breeze on the Silver Line from the airport, although a bit of a walk to public transportation. We ended up cabbing it to MFA Boston but walked to the North End and back. All and all, I'd stay here again and recommend it to others as a conference location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, good, and good.”
Reviews.Author: lolawally
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. A new hotel: crisp decor, spotless, good service, comfortable, quiet. I am a frequent Marriott customer and this is one of the better Marriott's that I've stayed at. It's close to the airport, but not a great spot for sight seeing. Decent restaurants within walking distance. The hotel restaurant has an over-priced lobster roll that wasn't that good, but otherwise, I like my whole experience. As a Marriott person, I received free Internet and concierge level, but if I wasn't the Internet was $16.95 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive without the ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: otr2much
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you want to be in the harbor area. Rooms are very expensive by most standards but the services like the restaraunt are very limited. The "full service restaraunt" offers the same menu as the bar, both of which are limited. Rooms are large and clean with flat panel HD TV/display. Internet is free in the lobby bar restaraunt area but 12.95 or 16.95 for wired/wireless in room at $350/night for the room, they should provide internet free.

Reviews.Title: “Bit out of the way, but excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessWashington
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star property to be sure - new, nice rooms, spacious, good service, etc. The only knock is that you need to be a walker or a patient person when waiting for a taxi. Very expensive place when Boston is full, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: antman57
Reviews.Content: Room was nice size with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was up-to-date with nice shower. Room has a great view of the harbor & city. Staff did an excellent job and were pleasant to deal with during our stay. Hotel is next to the Silver Line bus that was a very short ride to the airport & handled riders and luggage without a problem (and was only $ 2 each way per person). Hotel is close to one of the tour company pickup sites. Severel nice restaurants within walking distance with good food. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: rajesh_bondbook
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel.. Customer service is excellent.. Breakfast was very good.. and rooms were very spacious

Reviews.Title: “Great service & Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: luckieeloo
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this is brand new hotel or not, but I think it may be since it's in a newly developed spot on the Boston Seaport, walking distance from a few new restaurants. My boyfriend and I came for 2 nights for a wedding weekend for one of his college friends. Although we arrived a couple of hours before official check-in, which is 3pm, the very nice and efficient desk attendant allowed us to go ahead and check into our room. They also had the wedding welcome bag ready to go. They even left a message for us on the first night to make sure we received the welcome bag for the wedding. The whole hotel is nicely decorated and modern, but not in an obnoxiuos trendy way. I didn't check to see if they had in room free wireless. Even if you're not in a room facing the water (we weren't), you still have decent view of the city, though we had to look around the building directly across the street. Still the view was plesant and vast. I also wish I bought my swimming suit because they have a serene and sleek-looking lap pool indoors on the 5th floor that was virtually unused when we checking it out in the middle of the afternoon. The room itself was spacious and had room enough for empty areas and a 3 seater sofa. The bathroom was a standard size, and the bath products were nice, too - Aveda. The bed was plush and comfortable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat if I went back to Boston. My only caution would be staying on the seaport in the cold months because then it may be too cold to walk around the seaport and go into the city. Mid-Septebmer, when we stayed, the weather was still fairly warm and spring-like, and at night I didn't need a jacket to walk around. A light sweater was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The front desk staff was very efficient and professional w/checking me in and out. The room was clean and spacious. The king-sized bed was comfortable. The housekeeping staff cleaned the room well and replenished the toiletries but did not leave the breakfast order form for the next morning. Oh well... The coffee in the room was not very good. Starbucks is downstairs though. All in all, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay Minutes from Boston Airport”
Reviews.Author: kjbms
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. It 's just minutes from the airport and a short cab ride away from most attractions. The hotel was clean and efficient; what you would expect from the Marriott brand. The rooms had ample space and a bathroom with large, walk-in shower. The concierge here was incredibly friendly and helpful. He was able to get dinner reservations for us at the last minute at a great Italian restaurant. He also helped us navigate the city. The hotel is a block away from the waterfront and several nice restaurants, including Del Frisco's and Morton's. The local sightseeing tour also makes pick ups here in the mornings, which is ideal for sightseeing. Overall, the stay was convenient and met our expectations. I would stay here again on a trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Happytravels5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night mid-week. Very clean, large and bright room. The hotel is a bit removed from the wharf area .We arrived after 8p and thought that we were going to be stuck eating room service food from the hotel.Luckily, on the recommendation of the doorman we found a wonderful Italian restaurant right around the corner from the hotel. Would stay here again for the view and service, the rates are also much less than those right at the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a surprisingly convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NorthofDC
Reviews.Content: The Waterfront Hotel is in an area hardly existed a couple of years go. The hotel is perfectly maintained; it is one short block from a new waterfront area with a number of very popular restaurants; it is near the new Convention Center. It is a 5-minute drive from the Airport through the new Ted Williams Tunnel. There is a bus that goes from Logan Airport about every 8 minutes, and that same route runs in a special bus tunnel to South Station where you can transfer to the rest of the Boston Transit system. The rooms were beautiful; the staff was friendly and helpful. The conference held there had no glitches at all that we could see. The location, as I have described is not exactly in downtown Boston, but it is a pleasant "electric bus", taxi, or drive from the very center of Boston, and in exchange you get a brand new hotel on a brand new street, near an amazing number of brand new restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from everything”
Reviews.Author: Aaliz913
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too close to the fish market and the smell is quite strong. It's also a bit far from a subway station and the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for sightseeing, but a clean decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first trip to Boston. I honestly was expecting something better. The price was pretty good for Boston on a weekend so overall I was not to dissapointed with my decision. The hotel was a standard Renaissance hotel nothing to special. We went primarily for sightseeing and either took a short inexpensive cab ride ($10) to the downtown area, or walked which took about 20 minutes. Bed was comfortable, staff was average. I would probably not go out of my way to stay here again as I think Boston has some better offerings, but if the price was right I might. Overall Boston is a great city to visit with lots of sights. Weather is perfect in early fall/late summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Watch Out for Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: highcountrytraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, and my room on the 21st floor had a great view of Boston harbor. My room was large and comfortable. However, this is another new hotel that, in spite of being well designed and built, fails when it comes to service. The hotel would have received five stars if the breakfast had not been so poor. I had a business breakfast the first morning so we ate in the main restaurant. I ordered what I believe is billed as Organic Maine Oats, along with a bagel. The oatmeal arrived as a thin gruel and the toasted bagel was slathered in butter or some such spread. I would have sent both back, but since I was with other people, I only asked that the bagel be replaced with one toasted but dry. The waitress complied with my request, but certainly not with a smile. The breakfast buffet may have been much better than the off-menu food, but I did not get to sample that. The second morning I had breakfast in the Concierge Lounge on the 20th floor. The food was good, but all the cereal bowls were hot, as they were just taken out of the dishwasher. The attendant apologized for the hot bowls, a plus for service, but I do wonder why the management thinks that they cannot afford an extra set of cereal bowls so that their loyal customers do not have to pour cold milk into steaming hot bowls. For dinner at least, you can walk to the nearby Legal Seafoods and get a good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient both for tourists and corporate travelers”
Reviews.Author: torquan
Reviews.Content: Although some may find it not so close to many downtown favorites like the Harbor, North End and the Aquarium as the Marriott Long Wharf, this Renaissance is a true gem with helpful staff and plenty of amenities like free WiFi in all rooms, luxury toiletries, a 24/7 gym and a good restaurant for both buffet and dinner. Other good dining facilities like Legal Test Kitchen and Barking Crab are very close to the hotel. We stayed there for three nights with our older son who would to start his studies in Boston the following week. Good connections from the Silverline Courthouse MBA station with other parts of the city which are not within walking distance. We all liked this hotel and were happy to unwind and relax in our room after a busy day of walking and sightseeing the town our son will call home for the next two years. All in all, a very recommendable place to stay when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the fantastic Seaport district -near the new spots and handy to all the rest!”
Reviews.Author: Daytrippin_from_FLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night -we got a great rate to start with and hit a free upgrade to a city/harbor view -the room was super clean and basic. Very quiet. Breakfast was very good, typical city prices but a good value for the location-and very good service. This hotel is right in the middle of all the new restaurants at Seaport-literally-all the new(er) places are a very short walk-and then there's the ever-changing scene on Biston Harbor with so much boating action. I definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great and totally met our needs!”
Reviews.Author: lovedarain
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect for our needs. We were only in town for the weekend, so we were out and about in lots of parts of town. We took cabs mostly (which are pretty expensive in Boston) and it was nice that they all knew where the hotel was, and we never had to wait more than a few minutes for a cab. The lobby was a little bit on the smaller size, but it was nice and the staff was appropriately helpful and nice. The room itself was exactly what I expected. We had requested 2 beds and received them, the decor was typical hotel style so it looked clean and comfortable and functional. We had drinks at the hotel bar which was good, except that they closed at 12:30, but were kind enough to let us sit there for a while and finish our drinks and talk. My only complaint is the cost of internet; and it's often a complaint of mine at hotels. I don't understand how is could be justified to pay over $12 a day for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Yysguy
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 2 kids) stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. Upon check-in we were offered a junior suite instead of the 2 double bed room we had booked for. The room was a business room with a sofa that converted into a bed. They brought in 2 additional cots. The room was huge! The sofabed was not overly comfy but was adequate. We stayed because we loved the rest of the room. The hotel is located in the business waterfront area which had convenient access to the bus line / subway. We discovered later in our stay that there are many nice restaurants a short walk away. As we are tourists and wanted to see all the sights, most of the attractions involved taking a subway from this area. The pool is long and narrow so you can swim laps when it's not busy. There is a whirlpool as well beside it. Towels and a poolside shower are provided. The staff, from valet and bellman to conciierge and front desk, are all very pleasant. The concierge was especially helpful with directions as this was our first trip to Boston. Parking is a bit expensive ($40 self park and $50 valet) but there is a lot across the street where you can pay for parking for less but is less secure. Overall, this was a great place to stay. We loved the hotel and city and I would definitely consider a return visit to both.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Jlj22312
Reviews.Content: Really, really lovely hotel. Lobby was great. Staff was attentive. Room was clean and comfy. Especially loved how well appointed the room was - plugs where you need them, stylish furniture, etc. Great location, right next to YUMMY restaurants. Only complaints are small ones: The bathroom floor was a bit slippery. Should have gone with the natural travertine, instead of the polished. And, the bed wasn't the most comfortable I've ever slept on... but I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and minutes from everything”
Reviews.Author: Fou4u2
Reviews.Content: Hello this hotel is brand new and has all the amenities including free wifi. The restaurants and bars are within walking distance. I walked to Fanuiel Hall and Chinatown with no problem. Get a wonderful dinner at Legal Seafoods or mix with an eclectic crowd at Tamezcal. The views on the third floor at Legal Seafood is wonderful. The best Lobster Roll is at the end of the foot bridge at James Hooks Seafood great price $15 for a large roll. Cheap beers at Hennesy's next door to the Union Oyster House. Take the SL1 bus to the airport for $2.00, the stop is directly across the street from the Hotels's Congress Street entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if not odd”
Reviews.Author: gnalay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as an overnight stay before heading home the next morning. We picked this hotel because it was about 15 minute drive to Logan Airport and it was along the water. Pros: The rooms were very roomy and the color decor was very relaxing. As with your typical Marriott chain hotels, there were ample "business" amenities... Staff was friendly, there was a starbucks in the lobby, a business center and very clean. You can see the planes taking off and landing from Logan in your room. Cons: Parking was expensive. Asked valet if there was self parking, he said that it was full (not sure if I believed him), so we had to pay the $42 for 1 night of valet. The Internet was not free. The way that the hotel is structured is odd as well. They structured it in a V shape and when windows are wide opened, you can very clearly see into your neighbors room. You can also hear planes taking off and landing. It's just a muffled boom though, soft enough where you don't notice it if you're not listening for it. Other than that... I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It is not waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: GZaretsky
Reviews.Content: First of all you have to remember that Renaissance Boston Waterfront is not waterfront. It is across the street from waterfront and therefore it offers a panoramic view of large buildings and parking lots on all four sides. This hotel is seriously mismanaged. You feel this immediately upon arrival. It has this small driveway. The driveway is always clogged with some dead parked vehicles. Consequently, in order to check in, I had to circle the block three times! They charge $42 for â€œvalet parkingâ€�, but it is a sheer nightmare if youâ€™ll try to use it. They promise to deliver your car within 15 â€“ 20 minutes but it seldom happens. For instance, I had to wait for over 30 minutes while there was zero demand for cars. Itâ€™s not that they were busy, not at all. I stayed there waiting for my car while nobody did anything. They just donâ€™t care. I asked to see a manager, but he was too busy to see me. This hotel does not own its own garage. Weâ€™ve made August reservations back in June. They demanded full prepayment (which we did). Yet, upon arrival they had no room with two Quinn beds available as agreed. Consequently, a mother with two little children was forced to spend a night on the couch. There are plenty of other hotels around with better rates, with its own garages and not as chaotic atmosphere. Avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay for the most part!”
Reviews.Author: Chemandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th of July. We took advantage of a sale that was going on. It's a really nice hotel. Especially for what we ended up paying for it. The rooms were spacious and very clean. Except the brown hair all over my husband's pillow when we arrived. For a hotel with a 4 diamond rating to have someone elses clump of brown hair on their pillow for new guests is really the main reason why I did not rate them higher. Not quite what I was expecting. We did get the room on sale but Really??? The pool area was crowded and full of kids. Not a huge issue, we just didn't use it. The resturant in the hotel was very good but the breakfast buffett seemed a bit overpriced to me. My husband didn't eat because all he wanted was a hard boiled egg and some melon and he would have had to pay over 12 dollars for just those 2 things. The bar seemed reasonably priced and the bar staff was sooooo nice. We decided to avoid the masses for the firework show and the staff offered to let us watch the fireworks from a conference room. We didn't have to because the window in our room overlooked the city and we got a very good show from a distance. They have an interesting choice for carpet throughout the hotel. There is absolutely nothing "wrong" with it but for such a nice hotel it was weird seeing primary color almost child like rugs. Access to the T is very very close, this is also what appealed to us about this hotel. Doing the shuttle wasn't an issue at all. The waterfront area is nice. It's scale is kind of small and choices to eat are there but somewhat limitted. I would stay there again but probably only if it was on sale again. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was lacking but hotel was nice”
Reviews.Author: DesertRatTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great in that it has a great location-walking distance to restaurants and the stops for the sightseeing tours. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable and the amenities were fine. My only complaint was the customer service. The doormen/bellmen who stand at the curb did not greet us once during our entire stay. No one offered to help us with our bags-from the bell men to the front desk. The front desk always had many desk clerks available but none seemed to excited to help us. Smiles were infrequent. On one day we asked to borrow an umbrella and the desk clerk told us there would be a $40 charge for the umbrella until we returned it. This wouldn't have been as irritating if the umbrella hadn't been a complete piece of garbage. She only offered us one umbrella even though there were too of us and then told us that we probably didn't need it because it was not currently raining. I am glad I didn't listen to her because there was a torrential downpour a few hours later and it drizzled the entire day. That being said-the umbrella still wasn't all that helpful. It was a piece of junk and kept turning inside out with the wind. We bought a second umbrella from the drug store. We stayed here for 3 days, 2 nights and with the exception of the concierge who was very friendly and knowledgeable-the staff at this hotel is not friendly or helpful. I would not stay here again for this reason. The hotel itself is fine though.Also-the brand of shampoo/lotion they use which is Aveda is horrible and smells like garbage and patchouli.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: searay40dad
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel; it is close to several T stattions. However, it is NOT directly on the waterfront and is not immediately convenient to any restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean & close to lots of waterfront shops & restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Miami-Florida-USA
Reviews.Content: New clean spacious room with great views of the city and the waterfront. Check in was a bit slow due to understaffing. I was in town for 5 days on business and found the hotel easy to get back to from various points around town. Not enough coffee supply in the room, but after I requested more they made sure to keep me stocked.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient for the airport”
Reviews.Author: brooklintraveller
Reviews.Content: A great alternative to the airport hotels. One stop on the silver line bus from the terminals will bring you to the very comfortable Renaissance hotel in the redeveloped waterfront area of Boston. There are good restaurants in walking distance. Rooms are good-sized, many have a water and airport view and the beds are excellent. Overall a very good choice if you need airport access and a city location.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CdnGal25
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 loved this hotel - the decor, the amazing view from our room, the location. We arrived a couple of hours before check-in but they graciously had a room ready for us within minutes. Our teenage boys were quite impressed - as were we - with the room and the view of the harbour. We were within walking distance of North end but also very close to T station. And we enjoyed the walk along the wharf. Now, as with most Boston hotels, there is charge for internet (we declined as it was a family vacation) and parking (used garage across the street). There is Starbucks in lobby and person who can assist with directions/ assistance. Very helpful. There was also nice Italian restaurant around the corner, Salvatores. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DRECG
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a fine hotel...I would be happy to go back if business required this. Hwever, I was disapointed with the business center because it was not adequately equipped or maintained. The business center only has 2 computors, and one working printer. The other printer was out of toner. I did not travel with my laptop this visit, and I had to get up early, 6 AM to make sure I had access to the computor. The other minor point is that the inroom coffee service, only came with enough coffee packets for one person to have coffee. On the other hand, there was an inroom refrigerator. Rooms spotless and up to date, but not soundproof. These are relatively minor compliants and i would go on business again

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Hernan1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right on the waterfront (Boston Harbor), if you like walking, you can walk to downtown and even to the North End (little Italy), Aquarium, ICA (museum), 10 minutes from the Airport. If you like to take Public transportation, then you are in a perfect place, 3 minutes walking to the T (Boston's version of the Metro). Lots of places to eat withing walking distance. The only caviate is the cost., but summer time is the best time to go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Is a room with no bed okay? Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Dark_Karma
Reviews.Content: They apparently have classified one of their hospitality suites with a sofabed as a normal room they give people who have booked a King/2 doubles. As a business traveller, this is unacceptable. Unfortunately, I arrived during a heavy period late at night because my flight got delayed. UNACCEPTABLE, PEOPLE. Not only that, some of the staff seemed clueless that this was unacceptable. They said, people like to party in there. Um, I'm a business traveller, I am here to sleep (party comes separate). Don't advertise availability if it's not there. Unethical. Totally.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel--Great Location”
Reviews.Author: monte5
Reviews.Content: If you like the "waterfront" this is a terrific hotel---check in was fast and got a nice room overlooking the water-------suggest a high floor--- a lot of restaurants within a block the hotel---we will return----

Reviews.Title: “Convention visit”
Reviews.Author: Work_for_LIVE_events
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week long convention and it was great! The wifi worked perfect all over the hotel, the indoor pool is fantastic to swim a few laps, the gym is also very nice! Also the location is excellent if you are attending the convention center plus the train station is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful, but bring your white noise machine”
Reviews.Author: halltab
Reviews.Content: We stayed there while attending a conference at the World Trade Center, so the location was perfect. The room was large and the housekeeping staff excellent. Bed extremely comfortable and bathroom large. Front desk staff very helpful and friendly. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and our waitress Bernadette remembered us every morning, gave us tips on sightseeing, and generally made the whole stay seem special. The hotel wireless is not free but it is much faster and more reliable than most hotel wireless. The only problem is that we could hear people talking, noise from the street, plumbing from other rooms, so it was good that we had our white noise machine along. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaC202
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront hotel for a business conference at the convention center and had a great experience. While I've been to Boston many times I have never stayed at the waterfront and wasn't thrilled about the location compared to Back Bay and Copley, but my experience at the Renaissance made the location worth while. The hotel looks very new and modern, extremely clean lobby, restaurant and bar area. Check-in was quick and the staff took my Marriott rewards card immediately and were very helpful about places to go in the surrounding area. The room was spotless and a good size, the bed and pillows very comfortable...housekeeping was prompt and thorough. While the waterfront is a little further than I would normally stay the area seems very up and coming with beautiful restaurants, bars and markets right there - and a block away from the Renaissance. The hotel is not far from the silver line on the T, buses are close, South Station is about a 15 minute walk and Logan is right across the water. Consider the Renaissance Boston Waterfront hotel for your next visit -- you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Touring”
Reviews.Author: emrsnakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront the week of July 4th. It is very convenient because the Silver Line transit authority bus from the airport stops a 1/2 block from the back of the hotel, and it's quick. And it's easy to take this into the city for all your siteseeing. Very nice, newer hotel. Great location for foodies as there are a couple of terrific restaurants nearby, and an ice cream shop in the park across the street. The have very knowledgable concierges (they have a different name for them) right in the middle of the lobby to help with all your questions to get you started on where to go and what to do. It's a little farther from the action than the big downtown hotels, but you save on the rate, and getting to the subway line is easy. You're a block from the waterfront, with restaurants, etc. There's a great breakfast place around the corner that does take out. And a 7-11 and Duncan Donuts down the street. We could see the Roseway Schooner in the harbor from our room, which we toured on that night to watch the fireworks. Check them out, it's in town during the summer, and the crew will answer all your questions.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. not much in the area”
Reviews.Author: JohnP23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, modern and clean. There is not much to do or wealk to in the area though. Leage Seafood was good, but not much else to see

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to Boston World Trade Center”
Reviews.Author: xquizitluddite
Reviews.Content: The hotel is upscale and most convenient to restaurants and particularly the convention center, where the conference was held. While everything is done to accommodate guests, the $16.95 fee for an Internet connection in the room is really exhorbitant. Also, skip the $42 valet parking and park around the corner for $30.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine hotel with large rooms, great views and good locations”
Reviews.Author: RonFMiller
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel looked brand new and it was spotlessly clean. The rooms were large and bright with wonderfully comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cook7166
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel, it was very nice comfortable and most importantly CLEAN. Would recommend to anybody and everybody

Reviews.Title: “overpriced - and ambiguous advice”
Reviews.Author: friendofindia
Reviews.Content: Good points about this hotel are the very comfortable beds, quiet rooms and nice decoration. But some problems should be taken care of. The hotel is way overrated. Despite the price of the rooms, they charge everything including what should be provided for free - like bottles of water or wi-fi. Internet access is charged 16 a day extra. Unbelievable ! Do they know that any basic B&B now provides a free internet access ? . Another thing is when you ask the Concierge about a nice restaurant, she says she'll book you in her "favorite Italian restaurant" or some other nice seafood places downtown. But some of the restaurants mentionned strangely belong to the same company and happen to be shameless overpriced places - typical tourist traps. Is there any hidden interest behind this help ?

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great!!”
Reviews.Author: MJ525
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a two night stay in this hotel. We were in town for a wedding. We flew in Friday. We had an early arrival. From the airport we opted to take a water taxi to the hotel. The water taxi dropped us off at the world trade center right near the hotel. From there you just have to cross the street to get to the hotel. The water taxi is $10 per person for one way. You can opt for a $17 round trip. We took the one way. and figured we would just take a cab on our departure. The cab would turn out to be much faster and cheaper. The view of the harbor and city skyline is amazing on the way with the water taxi. When we arrived at the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised when they told us a room was ready. We arrived way before check in time to get a jump start on our trip. We had a standard king. The room was super big. The bathroom was typical size. The room had a king bed, a work station, a full size sleeper sofa, coffee table and a chair. It was the biggest standard king i have ever stayed in. A marriott / Renaissance bed is the best bed you will find in a hotel. i never heard any hallway noise in our room. The view was just average but ok for us because it is not why we stayed there. The location of the Long warf is better than this hotel, but there is plenty to do around this hotel as well. Plus it is a short cab ride to the best spots. Or you could walk the two miles if you would like. We walked and regretted it. We happened to be up here when temps tipped 100 degrees. On a cooler day the walk would be great. The hotel is only a couple yearsw old and feels brand new. The breakfast in the hotel restaraunt was great. It is a bit pricey for the buffet but very good food. I recommend the french toast! The staff was very helpful and attentive. Wireless comes at a cost of $16 a day. the lobby has a couple computers in the lounge area where you can use the internet for free. They just ask that you keep your usage quick to allow others the chance to use it. There is also a business center that we had the chance to use a couple times. We never had to pay anything, but i have in othe Renaissance hotels. Valet is around $35 a day i think. I did not have a car. The hotel is only a ten minute drive by cab. the cost is around $15. I love Boston and love to stay in the city when we go. Unless i find a really cheap rate on a different hotel, I will stay at this hotel first. I strongly suggest this hotel for any travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! No doubt -we will go back!”
Reviews.Author: ryzach
Reviews.Content: We had booked this trip with Priceline (name your own price) and got a fanstatic rate for the 4 days we stayed. The front desk staff were excellent. Our luggage was delayed 2 days, and the staff were more than accomodating to our situation. Very helpful with directions and suggestions on restraunts in the area. One of the days we stayed, the Stanley Cup had arrived in the lobby - surrounded by tons of people and security -an employee took my 2 boys strainght to the front to let them get a picture with it! Outstanding! The rooms were clean and modern. The lounge was always busy, however the hotel restraunt always looked bare (we never ate there). Room service is available and pretty standard as far as taste and cost go. The swimming pool and hot tub area was never crowded and kept neat and clean. Only drawback to the pool is that it only goes to 4ft deep. Location was on the waterfront -we walked everywhere or road the subway. Silver line stops right behind the hotel (also goes to and from the Airport for $2pp - much better than the $20 cab fare). Overall -fantastic stay and would recommend to everyone traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Seaport hotel instead.”
Reviews.Author: Naamba
Reviews.Content: I was able to compare this hotel and the Seaport Hotel (1 block away) in the same week and the two are very different and here's why: This Hotel has a very modern but 'cold' feel as you walk in. And what's with the glass orbs behind the desk? Even the lobby bar has hard plastic seats whereas the Seaport has tons of squishy seating in there huge lobby area. I think my biggest gripe with this hotel is NO WIRELESS! And you have to pay $16 a day for wired access-- c'mon even Super 8 has Free wireless and for $300+ a night, a staple these days is expected. And yes the Seaport has free wireless and its pretty fast (8 mps). The Seaport's restaurant is much more quaint and the staff is friendlier. Again, it felt like I was in a cafeteria with it's modern decor in this hotel's restaurant. Even though they are almost next to each other, the Seaport has the better location-- seems to be in the center of it all versus the Renaissance on the 'end' surrounded by parking lots and busy roads. But in the end it's the little things like built in shampoo on the shower walls, little shoe polish sponges, robes, $80 cheaper per night, live jazz and a 7 Eleven across the street that makes the Seaport Hotel a clear favorite in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: mewosery
Reviews.Content: Mixed feeling for this stay (4 nights), here are the resons why: CONS: 1. they screwed up the reservations and claimed to have upgraded our rooms, when in fact that did not happen, instead we were given a lower category room for our club level room category. 2. when trying to fix the error (3 times) on their part, was given a lecture of why we shouldn't get club access (concierge), after the fourth try they finally figured out why we were requesting the access, BECAUSE we were PAYING for it (as part of our reservation) and not asking for a freebie. 3. No amends were made at the time the error was recognized, had to call Mariott customer service for clarification who then raised the issue to the on-site manager, who did respond until the 3rd day into our visit, offerring to 'move' us to the higher level for the remainder of our stay. Really after being in the room for 3 days, does anyone really want to pack everything to move for the balance of my stay, waste of my time. 4. Club Lounge: breakfast was crazy, they didnt have food at 8AM when breakfast ends at 9:30AM, no milk, no bread, no bagels, no fruit, no eggs (continental breakfast) and no coffee (and when they did it was cold and bad). Running out of the most basic of fruit, the banana. What a shame!!! Plus they only had one person servicing the lounge who couldn't do everything, felt back for that guy. 5. Club Lounge--it was a shame that they did not extend the hours of the lounge on 7/4 so that people can enjoy the fireworks that started at 10PM. I would think that management would make an exception to accomodate so that people can enjoy the unobtsructive view into the city, but no, we (approx 30 ppl) were requested to leave. 6. Navigator (direction guide, concierge)--was slow, we had to wait on long lines to get information and when we did they weren't really helpful and I found the staff rude. PROS: Housekeeping: Was efficient as our room was cleaned up within an hour when leaving for breakfast. Club Lounge: have to give points to the staff managing the lounge who work alone with no back-up when it gets hectic. Facilities: clean, pool was nice and gym was suffice. Rooms: Okay rooms some smaller than others,w ith desk, chair (ours was broken), television, bed(s)-one squeaked the other didnt' and plain old regular bathroom, nothing stellar.
