Neighborhood--as this hotel was in the Seaport (South Boston), not far from Boston itself, definitely walkable, had various restaurants around, night life was vibrant.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: spedy1
Reviews.Content: Prices notwithstanding (business trip- everything paid for by company) this is a great hotel! Courteous staff, clean rooms, very comfortable beds, and easily accessible from the Mass. Tpke. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: drnason
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for two nights during our first trip to Boston. I thought the hotel was CLEAN, and the staff was very friendly and helpful (except the ladies at Starbucks :( ). I didn't know what to expect but loved the beds, and got helpful information from the concierge. Boston was fun, wish there were more restaurants in the nearby area of the hotel. Had no trouble catching a cab, riding the T, riding a pedicab, or even the trolley tour. Will be back. And will stay here if the price is right. Only wish wi-fi was included....

Reviews.Title: “Fresh New Hotel Near Airport and Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Meister2
Reviews.Content: This Renaissance is sparkling, fresh and has a fantastic view overlooking Boston Harbor. It is a short taxi ride from the airport and sits a short walk from multiple good restaurants. I needed an overnight layover at Boston's Logan Airport and chose this hotel instead of one of the airport hotels. It was much nicer and just as close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Chantell
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!! We went to Boston (from NYC) for a weekend girls' trip to celebrate a birthday. We arrived very early on a Saturday (around 10:00am) so we could enjoy both weekend days to their fullest and expected to check our luggage with the concierge before checking in later that day. However, they had a room ready so we were allowed to check-in early!! And, while checking in, the front desk asked us what brought us to Boston (small talk I thought) and we said it was to celebrate a birthday. Not only were they so nice about it, but when we got back much later that night, we unknowingly had a bottle of champagne and 6 chocolate-covered strawberries waiting for us in the room with congratulations note for the birthday girl!! Truly amazing and thoughtful and very unexpected! Also, the location is perfect (along the waterfront) and very easy to get to and from downtown Boston and the airport via the Metro system! Loved it and would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Has its perks, but not the best for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: My recent stay was for business and having never been to Boston before, I can't say that I would choose the Seaport area again. Even though I don't know much about the city, it seemed as though I was pretty removed from many of the famous sights and attractions. Nonetheless, the hotel is beautifully appointed and has good facilities (club lounge, fitness room, pool). The staff was generally helpful and nice. I did find the room service (a necessarily evil during my stay) to be lackluster and pricey, even for room service. The beds there are DIVINE... best night's sleep I have had in awhile.

Reviews.Title: “WORST customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: J925
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my new husband in April. We stayed for 2 nights, 1 prepaid for on hotels.com and one prepaid on expedia.com. I left a cc for incidentals. A month later I was charged for one of those nights even though it was prepaid. I called customer service and had to fight for a credit. Well, it happened again now in June for the other prepaid night. I was charged again and dealt with 2 very rude customer service agents. The most recent kept me on hold for over 20 minutes before I hung up. This was their ever and they didn't deal with it professional. As a travel agent, I would never recommend a Marriott hotel again after dealing with this. If you book online and pre-pay, make sure to check your statements because chances are you will get charged again by the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Renaissance Waterfront. I had a regular King room that faced Congress Street. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was managing a small group of guests and the front desk staff was great at making the last-minute changes to the reservations. A Nor'easter had hit and delayed several flights, which meant I was down at the front desk late at night and early in the morning making sure that my team's rooms weren't canceled because of a 'no show'. I had a regular room and it was a decent size. Housekeeping was good at keeping it tidy during my 6 days. The 606 Restaurant is still pricey but the food and service were excellent. The business center was decent and had a functioning copier and fax machine. It's pay-per-service deal and on the expensive side. However, if you have small copy and fax jobs, the front desk may do it for you for free. The concierge lounge was closed Friday evenings, Saturday and Sunday. This is disappointing but pretty much standard in all Marriott properties. My biggest complaint is that they still charge for internet service. $12.95/day plus tax. All the upper-tier Marriotts do and, as a business traveler, it is one of the most frustrating charges.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Ezzmay_Petunia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business. This is a modern, clean hotel. The room is spacious and well maintained. The bed was lovely and comfortable. The staff are not particularly engaging/ friendly, but very polite, professional, and helpful when asked. The restaurant and bar provide good quality food and service. The location of the hotel initially seems remote from the city centre, but I walked into the city and this only took about 10 minutes. So it was actually closer than I thought. It is also well served by the tourist bus. If this area suited you for business or pleasure, I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS ... Not Your Daddy's Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Diva1
Reviews.Content: If you need a great hotel with a great location in Boston the Renaissance Boston Waterfront is the one. It's located 3 miles from the airport on the new Legacy Wharf and has beautiful spectacular views of the harbor. The hotel has the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in and I love the "Heavenly Bed from Westin" but these are more comfortable. LTK and Legal seafood are right next door and in walking distance, The banquet food is unbelievable, if you have a meeting there you MUST order the lobster MAC & Cheese. My group loved it so much I ordered it again for lunch on the last day and everyone was pleasantly surprised! This hotel has a really cool and funky decor, very hip and a great bar and Sal is the sweetest Bartender you will ever meet. Peggy at the Concierge Desk is so friendly, extremely helpful and knows all the best restaurants, lobster spots and places to visit. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location is ok unless your attending the convention center”
Reviews.Author: business_travel81
Reviews.Content: This was a newer, very beautiful hotel. The rooms very nicely decorated and a very modern feel to them. My room was ready for me for early check-in and I was able to get a room on the top floor that gave me great views from my room. The hotel can't change it's location but it is not too convenient to go to bars or much of the Boston nightlife. I was attending a conference at the convention center and I love Marriott properties so it was located well for me. However, the bar could have been opened later. With the hotel being sold-out I would imagine they would keep the hotel bar open later then 12:30am. We ended up walking to the Westin down the street which had their bar open until 2am. Other than that it was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, safe but boring neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jjjosephjjjoseph
Reviews.Content: A nice, very clean, newer hotel with everything you could expect for the price. The hotel's only downside is the neighborhood--it's pretty isolated from the rest of Boston and consists of only a few office buildings, two condo buildings, and some hotels. There are only a few restaurants, mostly in the ~$20/entree range, and nothing by the way of nightlife. The area is incredibly clean and safe, though. However, downtown is easily accessible by the Silver Line with stops nearby, so its easy to get to some more stimulation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Leesontour
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 5 nights at this hotel and although not located in downtown Boston, was in a lovely up and coming waterfront location, with plenty of bars and restaurants within 5 minute walk. Check in was slightly rushed as the receptionist seemed more interested in sorting out the luggage of her previous client than looking after us. Had to ask about the Executive Lounge, even though a gold member and given no details of the hotel or services or even the location of the lift to our room!!. Oiginally allocated a room with connecting door, which as I'd requested a quiet room was slightly strange, but changed rooms the following day. Lower floor room but no noise from road or other rooms throughout the stay. Advised hotel in advance we were celebrating our wedding anniversary but no mention at check in, which was disappointing. Hotel is a 20 minute stroll from Long Wharf or the Silver Line can be taken into the centre just 5 minutes from the hotel. Good quality bars and restaurants very close by, but they do get busy so you may want to consider booking in advance. Hotel bar was very pleasant, although drinks more expensive than some bars, service was excellent and you expect to pay more than in a normal pub. Gym facilities are also excellent, with a good range of equipment in pleasant surroudings. Executive Lounge doesn't have the range of food available for breakfast that we've found in other locations and did run out of some items. It's not open over the weekend and no alternative free dining is offered. Pleasant stay and would certainly return,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: xcatch
Reviews.Content: Great spot to get into the city, near a T stop and a short walk to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near convention center”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTripster
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to the convention center...modern with good ammeneties. Reasonably close to the major attactions in Boston and convenient to the airport. Many restaurant choices close by.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: The usual Boston Seaport hotel was booked out, so trying this hotel was a pleasant experience. Overall my stay at this hotel was very nice. It is clean, comfortable and reasonably quiet. The check-in process after a long transatlantic was incredibly slow, but i think the person in front of me was asking 1000 questions, so no real reflection. I had a room at the very end of the hall on the 14th floor and the only noise I ever heard was the occasional door closing in another room, emergency services vehicles at night, but this is all normal. The restaurant was OK. The food was exceptional, I had the scallops the first night. What lest this place down is the service. Its more about getting you in and out, but to get you in when no one is there, and then set up a separate table did not make sense. Id stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for this particular stay...somewhat isolated from main part of city”
Reviews.Author: ChiefJack
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a family of five makes it difficult to find accommodations for a reasonable price in any city but not so here in Boston. The room in this Marriott property was fine for us, with a roll-out bed there was plenty of room. The lobby was brightly lit, two-story and clean with an interesting design. The music that greets you as you enter the hotel has a modern vibe which suits the decor. That's about where it ends for the positives... Check-in was painfully time consuming, there was insufficient staff and a manager had to find some others to work the line (he could have done it himself). As a Marriott member wanted to use the the concierge floor but it was not open during the weekend we stayed which was annoying, staff offered no other options. There is a Starbucks in the lobby that became the alternative to have a breakfast. The lobby lounge seconded as the hang-out for us after a long day of sight -seeing Parking is expensive for this pat of the city, there are some options, but plan on a 30+ dollar hit each day. Forget about using your car, boston is a walking city, but from this hotel you have to take a cab or T ride. We walked once but it was simply too far for the younger kids. BIG disappointment for the kids (and equally for me and the Mrs.) was when management closed the pool after our first night...it was closed for the remainder of our 4-day stay. Staff offered us an option to use a hotel pool two blocks away. Yeah, right, like walking with the kids to a hotel two-blocks away in 40 degree temperature in swim trunks is an option. NOT. The fitness room was very clean, and well stocked with bikes, ellipticals, treadmills and weight machines. And, a very clean sauna (if only the darn pool worked.) The lobby lounge had a decent finger foods menu, and the wine offerings by the glass were varied (stingy pours). Comfortable seating and lots of space to spread out, there are computers in the lobby. I wouldn't stay here with the family again, but it was close to the convention center. If this stay had been for a business trip (and the amenities we available) i would probably stay. +

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust the reservation process”
Reviews.Author: phil08848
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a large family with small children, we booked our hotel 6 months in advance, because they were the only hotel that promised us double beds in adjoining rooms. When we arrived, not only did they not have any adjoining rooms with double beds available, the front desk staff informed us the hotel didn't even have rooms of that type. The best the hotel could offer for $3,500 for a three night stay was that our 7 year old could watch her younger siblings in a room next door to mine. Were they serious? Nothing aggravates me more than a hotel that takes a reservation for a room type they don't even have. Marriott shouldn't let this hotel use their name.

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale for none-upscale prices”
Reviews.Author: JonathanMV
Reviews.Content: Not right in downtown but only about a 10 min walk across from the downtown area. Very clean, new, upscale look and feel but can be very affordable. The rooms were spacios. We were in a room for 3 people and they offered 2 doubles versus 2 queens so a bit tight for those sharing a bed but I heard from others that the King size rooms are amazing! Great washroom, using Aveeda bath products, each room has a fridge and safe and there is a Starbucks in the lobby! They only offer valet parking which is $42 US a night but around the corner from the hotel is a parking lot for $30 per day (but you can't drive your car in and out throughout the day).

Reviews.Title: “If you like walking its a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebiz
Reviews.Content: its between airport ($16-20 ride) and downtown. The green bus tour stops at this hotel and you can buy the $36 two day pass in the lobby. It makes 24 stops around the city. Get off/on, bus every 15-20min. Parking at hotel is over $40/day. $15 tax to Italian restruant area. Too many good restruants to chose from. USS Constitution, north Church. Harvard, Cheers are on bus stop tour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: masadavt
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was just great. Smoothest/fastest check-in ever, the rooms were beautiful and the beds very comfortable. Quiet, clean....great breakfast buffet. Julie at the front desk was extremely kind and helpful. The only drawback I can see is the location; its a bit of a hike to get downtown and we ended up taking cabs everywhere. The one thing they could improve upon is the concierge; they just did not seem all that knowledgeable or up-to-date with the events going on around the city. If I was a concierge, I think I would make it my business to know what is happening locally and be able to give recommendations based upon the type of group you have. For example, we heard that there was going to be a free Earth Day outdoor concert downtown and wanted to know where it was located. The concierge had no idea that there was one, and after looking on the internet, told us that Earth Day wasn't until May....after some back and forth she realized she was looking at last years schedule. There were a few similar incidents and generally speaking she just was not helpful or even that friendly. Also the pool is very narrow, which disappointed the kids. Other than that, I have nothing but compliments to the staff and I will definitely stay there the next time I go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bluepaws
Reviews.Content: If you are attending a conference at the BCEC then this is a good choice. Otherwise, there are cheaper and better locations to stay in Boston. Overall my stay at this hotel was very nice. It is clean, comfortable and very quiet. I had a room at the very end of the hall on the 10th floor and the only noise I ever heard was the occasional door closing in another room. It has a large fitness center, full length lap pool, sauna, and a hot tub. The breakfast buffet was good but extremely overpriced at $22 and the dinner selections were at best just okay. Better to walk around the corner to LTK or Salvatore's. It is located in South Boston a short walk from the convention center. There are a handful of other hotels and a few restaurants in the area but not much else to do. The silver line runs close by so it's easy to get to other more intersting areas of Boston. Fairly expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...HORRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sunnydays2007
Reviews.Content: To start off, this is a nice hotel. The rooms are well appointed and clean and I would stay here again if the customer service wasn't so bad. I booked my hotel 3 months in advance and made a specific request for a king sized bed. I requested the bed not only through room selection, but through a note and a phone call. When I arrived, they placed me in a double bed room and the receptionist told me that "to her dismay" there were no king sized beds available and that there was "nothing that can be done." The best part of sleeping in a hotel is the chance to sleep in a bed bigger than your own. Instead, I had to stay in a room by myself with two beds that are smaller than my bed at home. For $250 a night, I was not happy. The safe in my room did not work, and because I was expected at a conference in 20 minutes, I did not call the front desk to have it fixed. Having it fixed while I was gone would have defeated the purpose of using the safe in the first place, and without the safe, I did not feel comfortable having my room cleaned, so I missed out on the service that you expect when staying at a hotel. When I checked out with CAROL at the front desk and mentioned the issues I had while I was staying there, she told me there was nothing she could do for me. The price could not be adjusted (even though the double bed rooms were cheaper than the king rooms at my time of booking) and there was nothing she could do out of shear customer service. She told me that I should have called the front desk about the safe and I explained to her that I had to leave the room and that having the safe repaired while I was away defeats the purpose of the safe in the first place. Carol looked at me like I was not worthy of her time or worthy of this hotel, and refused to even acknowledge that I was a customer who had an issue. As a business traveler on a company expense account, the discount was not what mattered to me. I wanted her to acknowledge the problems with my stay and at least apologize on behalf of the hotel. She represented the hotel horribly. Beware of the valet. I self-parked in the garage and the valet drivers were treating the cars horribly. They were speeding through the garage, cut other cars off, blasted the music and slammed the doors of the cars. I even saw one valet driver hit one car with the door of another car. I saw all of this in the short amount of time that I was in the garage so I can only imagine what the rest of the day looks like. You can park your car by yourself for $30 instead of paying some one $42 a day to trash it. If you are there for the convention center, try the Westin. It's attached to the convention center and seemed much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisbon01
Reviews.Content: I had a block of rooms sectioned off for a celebration. From the get go this was a pleasant experience. The event coordinator was accomidating, percise and timely with all correspondence. She made a previously difficult situation, easy. Our celebration took place on the Spirit of Boston (dinner and cruise), so the location could not have been better. The breakfast buffet and the drinks in the lobby bar were incredible. There are also great eateries just around the corner. Short cab ride to city center or a pleasant scenic walk to Faneuil Hall or North End. Public transportation also available. Easy in and out to all major highways.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl96
Reviews.Content: From check in until check out this hotel was perfect. I enjoyed being a guest during St. Patrick's Day and will return to the hotel if Boston again. The location was prime, I felt I could walk about and enjoy the city. The meeting facilities were nice & comfortable. I loved the break options; the food was presented with a nice touch. All the staff seemed to love working at this hotel. The room was clean and the decor was very modern. I loved the bedding and had a really good night sleep each night. I will return again & again. Thank you to the entire team!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Mandisha24
Reviews.Content: The waterfront hotel was a great option at a good price. It was right across the street from the Silverline Bus, which we grabbed from the airport and which also took us to the T for our explorations inside of Boston. The hotel room was clean, the Starbucks was cozy and had free wi-fi ( although it was only open until 7pm ). We asked for a room with a view of the Harbor and were not disapointed. I personally love that they have Aveda products available for you in the bathroom. The area is building up as well so by summer there should several more places to eat around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, chic, and eco/$ Green hotel in South Boston.”
Reviews.Author: complikada
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel is located in South Boston near the waterfront. It's within walking distance to a few restaurants (LTK, Salvatorre's Jerry Remy's.) There's also a deli/grocery store (Jace & Son's) that has yummy, cheap sandwiches and all kinds of snacks and drinks. There's a lot of new construction going on in the area. There will be more shops and restaurants opening up within the year. We attended the Penny Arcade Expo at the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center. It was a 10 minute walk from our hotel. Hotel: The decor of the hotel is very modern and chic. There's a restaurant, bar, and Starbucks in the lobby...very convenient if you don't want to leave the hotel! There is a Club Lounge that provides a delicious Continental breakfast, as well as an espresso machine and teas. On the 5th floor, there is a small pool, sauna, and work out room, so don't forget your exercise/pool wear. My fiancÃ© and I were given a hospitality suite since that was the only room available. (I'll elaborate about that later on!) The room was very large. It had a miniature galley style kitchen with a fridge, coffee maker, and sink. The room was decorated nicely with comfortable furniture and plenty of seating. It had a nice view (Large, bright windows) of South Boston and a small view of the waterfront. The bathroom was modern and clean. The shower had great water pressure as well. Internet and parking is very expensiveâ€¦so be sure to budget that. Service: We checked in about midnight on Friday night. Apparently, the hotel was over-booked so we were given a hospitality suite on the 5th floor. (It worked out in our favor because the standard rooms were quite tiny!) Will, who was working the front desk, was friendly and nice, but unaccommodating. We were tired after a long drive and found out that we were to spend the night on a sofa mattress instead of a real bed. After some coercing, he offered us free internet for the night in the hotel room though we were unable to connect in our room. He also granted us access to the Continental breakfast in the Club Lounge. The following night, there was a Jazz band gala concert on the 3rd floor. We could hear the music in our room! Once again, we went to the front desk. They offered to change our room to the 7th floor, but since it was our last night. The front desk clerk could have been more understanding. I mean, was it our fault that there was a jazz concert and we didn't want to go to it?! Sunday morning, we checked out of the hotel. We asked for a feedback card since we were not very happy about the cost/service of the hotel. Mike, the front desk clerk, was very understanding and really listened to our complaints. After explaining our situation, he gave us a $10 card for breakfast at Starbucks, as well as a $100 gift card to any Marriott hotel. This was the service we desired and we left Boston feeling happier instead of stressed out and unhappy. Overall: I was going to give this hotel 3 stars, but I added a star because of the the professionalism and understanding nature of Mike. He really went out of his way to make us feel better about our stay. The hotel is nice, modern, and green. I liked how they were eco-conscious in the rooms. If you do stay at the hotel, try to find out if there is a conference or event going on to be prepared for extra noise. And if you have a complaint or concern, speak to Mike or someone who will take the time to listen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: NapaWineLover
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was "ok" - not great but not horrible either. The pros: Nice rooms, very clean and bright with a comfy bed and nice flat screen TV. The cons: The plumbing! I can't believe no one has complained about this on TripAdvisor - the noise emitted by the plumbing system is unbelievable! When our neighbor used the shower, the vibration and noise was horrible - fortunately, we had to be up early so it didn't wake us up but if I'd wanted to sleep in I would be a really unhappy camper. Either a room near us has a jacuzzi or something is seriously wrong on the 7th floor! Our shower made alot of noise on it's own so I don't think it's a jacuzzi next door. The other big con was the restaurant - my husband and I went down on Sunday AM for an early breakfast and were told it was a 15-20 minute wait so he went off to Starbucks and I decided to come down later. When I returned solo, there were two empty eats at the "bar" area by the kitchen. I was told I could not sit here and would have to wait. The hostess I spoke to promptly disappeared and about 10 minutes later, another hostess wandered over and said, "are you waiting for a table"? The seats were still empty at the bar but she seated me at a 2-top. The food was good albiet expensive but no worse than the other hotels in this area. Parking is $42/day and internet is $12.95-16.95/day so make sure to factor this into your budget. There is no self parking at the hotel with the garage nearby costing $30/day. I know this is Boston but this just seems excessive to me when we are already paying big bucks for the hotel itself! Give me free internet at least! If Hampton and Fairfield can do it, surely the Renaissance can! I'd stay here again but would definintely check the Seaport or Westin first!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay...”
Reviews.Author: debpNh
Reviews.Content: Being a business travel and Marriott Platnium member I tried to avoid hotels on the weekends. However my husband booked us for a Saturday night in the city and this hotel was a very pleasant surprise. Very clean, good service, location with lots of food options, good breakfast, etc... really an "A" all the way around...

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place Expensive Stay”
Reviews.Author: prasanachand
Reviews.Content: This is a classy place conveniently locater at the downtown boston Harbor front. The room is extremely good. Clean and cozy. The hotel has a nice ambience with bar and restaurant at the ground floor. The service was really nice. Its walkable to most places in Boston downtown area with a nice great view. The only thing that sucks is the parking, it cost 30 40 bucks to park the car. No free parking, so with expensive rates and parking fee it becomes a costly stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business”
Reviews.Author: FinnVT
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd business related stay at this hotel. The location is great, staff is friendly and the facilities are well kept. The surrounding area is growing and now features more dining options - some within walking distance. Public transporation is right near the hotel if you wish to go a bit further away. We had a noise issue the first night of our stay - we were kept up through the night by the guests next door. The following morning we notified the desk and it was managed quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: H&B_love_to_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights Feb 2011 on a mini-vacation to boston to watch some NHL hockey. The hotel is wonderful-- very clean, staff helpful and friendly, quiet rooms. Not sure if we would have paid full price, we got a deal through "friends & family program" with marriott for $99 a nite. parking was steep at $42 a day, but that's boston. the bus stop was practically across the street from the hotel which easily transferred to the subway system. The hotel is a little far to walk to places, especially in the winter, but the subway is easy to take. We did not eat in the restaurant, but wished we would have had breakfast there as other places were a bit far to go for breakfast. All in all, a wonderful stay, we would definately stay again if we got a deal on the price. One thing though-- the swimming pool is only a lap pool @ 3.5 feet deep, not great for recreational swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Such good value”
Reviews.Author: korkybuz
Reviews.Content: Having read others reviews thought that this may be a little out of the way but was delighted to find that it's not, a 10 min hike to downtown, and a few good eateries on the doorstep. It is also convenient for the airport bus shuttle. The staff were very helpful and the rooms generous. the sauna and leisure facilities were not busy, I would happily stay there on any trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “New and Noteworthy”
Reviews.Author: Leighdee30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was priced reasonably for it's view and location. It is new and very clean. Not crazy about the decor, but there is a Starbucks in the lobby and good restaurant. Try the Jonnycakes for breakfast!!! We used valet parking and walked everywhere or took the T. We were able to walk to the Aquarium, restaurants, and Faneuil Market was not that much further (if you are not in a hurry). They have free internet on a couple of computers in the lobby area. We stayed there twice in less than a month. There is a nice bar if you want a cocktail before turning in for the night. Drinks are a bit pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there if you need an Invoice”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Lima51
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Booking.com. When checking out I asked for an Invoice which I need for my accountacy. I have been told that it was impossible since the invoice had been sent to the travel agency !!! In spite of having explained that there were no travel agencies involved, that I had booked via Internet with booking, that the room was paid with my credir card, etc, etc, no way. They wouldn't give me the invoice. I was told that I should contact Booking. So, upon return to Portugal I contacted Booking explaining the problem. They were quite efficient, they put me on hold on the phone while they were calling the hotel. After 10 minutes on hold, the clerk from Booking came back to me quite astonished. Why? Because Reanaissance Waterfront Hotel was saying that I didn't stay at the Hotel !!! I reassured that I had stay at the hotel and even had an invoice issued by the hotel for my extras. ( In fact the Hotel did not want to give me the invoice for the room but they gave me one for the extras ). So, after giving the number of that invoice, my credit card number and other information, the hotel finally admited that I stayed there. But they kept on saying that they could not give me an invoice. This time they allegued that my account was paid by someone else. And all of this after a 30 minutes phone call !!!! Because in my credit card account the amount paid to the hotel was not yet debited I couldn't do anything else either than wait and see. 24 hours later my credit card was debited. Again I called Booking informing them that now I had an evidence that the account was paid with my card and asking them to contact the hotel again asking for the Invoice. Funny enough a few minutes later I received an email from Renaissance Waterfront Hotel with an account statement ( not an invoice ) printed on a blank paper. Nothing in that paper mentioned where it was coming from. It could be anything issued by no matter who. So, if you intend to stay at this hotel and if you need an invoice for your company's accountacy, better go somewhere else.......

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a bad location”
Reviews.Author: MrsBee711
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel, people warned us it was too far from everything and we wouldn't like it. They said we should book downtown. The best thing about this hotel is the transit station less than five minutes away, and we never had an issue getting places (thanks in part to the fab transit system). The only disappointing thing was my husband has platinum membership and the club lounge wasn't open on our floor - he was very excited to go in. Instead, we were given coupons for breakfast (but just for him, not me - so those got thrown into the garbage) and appetizers in the lounge/restaurant and a non-alcoholic drink (which we used one of, but didn't bother because the menu didn't have anything we really desired). But seeing as those things are perks, and we certainly didn't need to receive them, I'd say the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very average all around”
Reviews.Author: Btrbos
Reviews.Content: If u have a lot of money, this is not the hotel for you. The queen beds are really full size in tiny rooms. No one was at the hotel yet we still got placed next to the elevator. U have to use their Internet service even if u have an Ipad. And despite our calling ahead, we had to wait 20 minutes for purr car only to find four guys sitting there and our car had been in the drive the whole time. Warning...valet is $40.....crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, slightly inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Needagoodbed
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a short stay in Boston at a very nice, very comfortable hotel at a price less than equivalent quality hotels elsewhere. The queen room was spacious and the bed was fantastic. Combined with the quiet location, this made for very good sleeping. The bathroom was spacious and bright. The fitness center was nicely equipped with aerobic equipment, freeweights, and newspapers. One mark against the hotel is that there is no comfortable sitting space in the lobby, which is therefore just a place to walk through, not to linger in. I toyed with the idea of giving 3 stars after the fifth day in Boston and the extra effort of getting to and from the hotel. We were using public transit and purchased a 7 day MTA pass (a great value if you are in Boston for an extended stay). Though the Silver Line MTA stop is a block from the hotel door, the inconvenience is that to go almost anywhere, you need to transfer from the Silver line to the Red line (and then perhaps make another transfer). The extra transfer leg got tiresome after a few days. But the hotel is a solid 4 star ranking, so I decided not to take a star off for this. But this is something visitors should know about. If you're taking taxis, no problem. If you're in Boston for a couple of days, it's probably OK too. If you're a good walker, you can easily walk to tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a little out of the way...”
Reviews.Author: learl
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Renasissance from Nov 11-14, 2010. We flew in from Buffalo. The hotel is in the Seaport District, which seems to be a new and upcoming area. We took the subway everywhere we wanted to go. Hotels are expensive in Boston, but we did get a discounted rate at this hotel. My only complaint is that this hotel is out of the way from downtown. You can get to it by taking the red line subway to (south station) then take the silverline and get off at the World Trade Centre stop and walk for about 5 min. The rooms in this hotel don't match your inital impression based on the front lobby. The front lobby is beautiful, all wood, with really contemporary decor. Then once you head up to the rooms, the hallways are orange and blue, and the rooms look like something out of a cottage brochure, with painted white wood walls....very odd. Our room had one king bed (amazingly soft with lots of pillows), a desk, a full couch, a fridge and a safe. The view overlooked the City and the Harbor, very nice. The bathroom was incredibly clean and impressive. Overall I would recommend this hotel only to travellers who have to visit the seaport or are in no hurry to get around the City. We basically only used this hotel to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Three night stay with neither problems nor delights”
Reviews.Author: DACWDC
Reviews.Content: Average isn't bad - it's average so don't take my average rating as a slam. At check in, the front desk folks were neither rude nor friendly. They just did their job. I cracked a joke about it being so windy and even if it was a lame joke, a smile couldn't have hurt. The cleaning staff was always pleasant in the hall and said good day or something nice. The room was clean and perfectly functional. The AC/heat had a fan function with two speeds and the higher level produced enough white noise for good sleeping. Shower had plenty of pressure. The location is fine from a 'close to the airport' perspective, but it's not really close ot much so if you're coming to Boston to see the city, this isn't an ideal spot. I will say Yes to if I would recommend it to a friend, but only on the condition tha they have a reason to stay in this area of the city and the price is similar to the others in the area. Otherwise, I'd tell them to book a hotel downtown or in Cambridge. The fitness center was average for a hotel like this - a few each of cardo machines and some machines. Not a good selection of free weights. Wireless internet was pokey. Direct TV was sketchy - maybe it was the weather. Not important, but if watching TV was important to you, it would be frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round”
Reviews.Author: AMBurke
Reviews.Content: Very good for location for getting around Boston - T Silver Line from airport stops just 2minutes from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY AT RENAISSANCE!”
Reviews.Author: threekiddos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Boston for 3 nights for our family of 2 adults & 3 children. We had two connecting rooms with a king and two doubles. It was wonderful that they could guarantee that in advance. The hotel is lovely and is in a good location in the seaport area. It is very close to the T and the Hop-on, Hop-off tour picked us up at the hotel in the morning. The rooms are very comfortable with refrigerator and nice sized bathroom. Lovely beds. The service was truly top notch. Everyone was so friendly and helpful - at the front desk and at the Navigator's desk. We were really appreciative and very impressed. Even when I was in line for the Navigator, one of the managers came over and asked if she could be of help so I wouldn't have to wait. It was really a nice hotel. The hotel's pool is a lap pool, but the kids could still play. There is a hot tub. Nice fitness room and changing room. J Pace's, right around the corner, is fantastic for breakfast and lunch. Salvatore's had fabulous pizza. Legal Test Kitchen was super. I would definitely recommend the Renaissance Boston Waterfront Hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: heymattyg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last week in October 2010. Fantastic hotel. Got a room at the end of the hotel (629) that had a great view, but more importantly, the room was huge! Giant picture window. The walk in shower was great. Called room service for dinner one night. Call was answered on the first ring and they addressed me by name. Dinner was great, too.

Reviews.Title: “excellence”
Reviews.Author: codegirl1224
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at this Renaissance last week and there is nothing I can say negative. The hotel is immaculate, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are large, the staff was very accommodating, and we felt very safe in walking back late one evening from Faneuil Hall. It isn't in the heart of the city, just a little south of downtown. Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Food in the restaurant was very good. Just wish the parking wasn't so expensive but that's most everywhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a great manager”
Reviews.Author: esmom2
Reviews.Content: We went for a "girls weekend" and we loved it ! This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are lovely. We had a problem with our frig and lost all the snack (cheese, strawberries, etc...) The Manager on over the weekend (Adam) went out and replaced everything we lost. I did not expect that at such a big place. We will be sure to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Double-K-Onthego
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront because no other hotels were available near Plymouth MA when we were in town. The hotel was outstanding and the staff was so attentive. We stayed in 4 hotels during our trip but the bed here was the best...the pillows..oh I wish I could have taken them home. Quincy Market was only a mile away and the main routes out of town were close.

Reviews.Title: “Regular at this Hotel - Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: MphsQueen
Reviews.Content: As a monthly business traveler to Boston, I prefer this hotel over all others. It's not close to tourist stops, but as a quiet comfortable place surrounded by excellent service, it can't be beat. Rooms are spacious and have nice touches of luxury for an affordable price. All rooms have floor to ceiling windows for excellent harbor views. It is right across the street from the concert venue on the harbor; so an excellent location for attending those gigs or hearing the tunes while eating outdoors. The restaurant in the hotel has an excellent chef who was featured on Top Chef Masters as a contestant.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in the Seaport District”
Reviews.Author: jaysonsmith
Reviews.Content: As stated, the Renaissance Boston Waterfront Hotel is located in Boston's Seaport District, which can be somewhat of a hike to the more touristy areas of Boston. This hotel caters primarily to groups and convention business, is located right next to the Boston convention center and a short cab ride from Logan. The quality of the property is above average, with spacious clean guest rooms, expansive lobby, bar / restaurant and business center amenities. The service however was rather spotty in areas (front desk, valet and phone). This could be due to the hotel catering primarily to corporate guests, but a friendly smile and welcome from the valet wouldn't have hurt. A quick call on the "Let us serve you" phone button rang for what must have been 5 times, and my request got a "yeah no problem *click*". Not exactly what I am use to from Marriott branded hotels. Also, the addition of a Spa would be a nice perk for the hotel. Overall though I was satisfied with my stay, and would stay there again if attending a convention or corporate function. Quick dining tip, the Legal Sea Foods next to the hotel is outstanding - stop by and check it out if staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lousy sound isolation”
Reviews.Author: REEMaryland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to the convention center and the Silver Line T as well as the still-growing waterfront area. Overall, the hotel was very clean and the staff was generally helpful and courteous. I did encounter a couple of less-than-friendly people in the bar and restaurant, but they were the exception. The room was a decent size. The technology was fairly up-to-date (ipod docking station clock-radio, flat screen TV with adjacent connection panel). Internet had two-tier pricing, so I saved a few dollars checking email. If you're expecting free connectivity, don't stay at a Renaissance. The restaurant had a fairly limited menu, but the food was quite tasty. Service at the lobby Starbucks was especially good. It didn't take many visits before they learned what I like to drink. The big drawback for me was noise. I asked for a quiet room and was given a room on a high floor and away from the elevator (thank you for that). Unfortunately, that room had a connecting door that provided almost no sound isolation from the neighboring room. My neighbors stayed up much later than I did and I could hear most of their conversations. I requested a different room and moved to a lower floor, also away from the elevator. I slept much better, but that's because my neighbors were quiet at night. One day that I was working in my room midday, I could hear muffled conversation. It wasn't as bad as the connecting room, but it was clear that my quiet nights were because I had quiet neighbors, not a well-isolated room. Hallway noise was fairly typical. I was pleasantly surprised by the lack of airplane noise considering I could watch planes land from my second room. I could hear the planes, but it wasn't bothersome. The "gift shop" was quite limited (really just a few shelves in the corner of the lobby). Normally I wouldn't even notice, but I needed a sweatshirt when the weather was unseasonably cold and couldn't get one here. If you're fairly tolerant of your neighbor's noise, this is a fine hotel, especially for a conference at the BCEC. If not, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Quietstrm
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from Sept. 2-5 with my 4 year old daughter. We arrived early and were able to check in around 1030am even though check in is stated as 4pm. This was a huge plus and started our day off well. We booked via priceline and got a decent rate. The Silver Line for public transit has a stop that is a short walk from the hotel. Very convenient and we rode the T our entire stay. Our room had 2 double comfortable double beds. We did not try the restaurant but it had a nice crowd. The hotel Navigator (concierge) gave us a map for the T and also had several written instructions for the popular tourist destinations. Hotel staff was helpful and nice. There are a few restaurants in walking distance of this hotel. It was very quiet until Saturday when more people arrived but there were still no issues. Housekeeping made our beds daily and I have no complaints in that area. The business center service to print your boarding pass was a nice touch. If you want, a nice clean hotel convenient to public transportation in a non busy area..this is a great hotel. If you want to be in the heart of the action right as you step out the front door of your hotel..this is not the hotel for you. It met our needs though.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Seaport district”
Reviews.Author: Jetset83
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Waterfront hotel is a new, modern incarnation of Marriott's Renaissance brand. I've stayed in other Renaissance hotels which are nice but may seem dated (think Marriott rooms and amenities but different color scheme). The one at LAX in Los Angeles comes to mind. But not this one. The Boston Waterfront location is modern and has a light, airy, fresh New England feel to the rooms with the white walls and blue carpet. Lobby is very modern and cool with a bar and restaurant as well as a Starbucks attached. My Platinum status was recognized on check in (I don't care that much, I'm humble) and that got me a room with a city and water view. Room actually had a mildew odor to it so I asked for a different room and got one- no problem, no questions asked. Also with the same view. Club Lounge on the 20th floor was nice for a complementary breakfast or after-work cocktail from the honor bar (mix yourself!) Warm cookies and canapes and a Nespresso machine to boot. At $178, this was a real deal compared to some of the hotels across the harbor going for twice that.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: soldier_21A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 20-22 AUG. Came up from FL to visit a friend deploying to Afghanistan. Wonderful time. Place is first class. Staff is very helpful. Take the bus from Airport ($2.00). Drops you off almost next to the hotel. Going back take a cab, it is just easier. Morton's Steakhouse is around the corner. A couple of great bars overlooking harbor also close (Irish place especially good). Checking in FRI, walked the Freedom Trail on SAT and caught a Red Sox game same night (MUST DO IT A "BEST PRO SPORTS EVENT"). Very good seafood place around the corner which serves until 1130 on weekends. There is not a downside to this hotel. I will stay here again. Fyi the Gym is also first rate. FYSA got to meet a lot of fun guests who were there for a wedding late on SAT night after the game. Cannot stress how gracious folks in Boston are, especially to military people. I have been assimilated into the RED SOX NATION. Army Officer

Reviews.Title: “Really really good stay”
Reviews.Author: cocolinu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Sunday to Thursday. Book a room through a conference happening at the hotel and got a cheaper rate (about 170$/night) With this cheaper rate, we also got free Wi-fi (otherwise contra-cost). However, we got one of the okay rooms, with a regular tub and shower, whereas the ones not booked through the conference will probably give you a walk in shower and a nicer decorated room. Had a double standard bed room with view of the marina. Clean, spacious, mini fridge, safe in the room. Loved their Aveda toiletries. On the negative side there was the bath tub issue and parking. Parking was a ridiculous 42$/night for a guest!!! Wait, didn't I already pay a lot of money on the room itself??? And then they want you to tip the valet at well. Please!!!! Parking for people eating at their restaurant: a reasonable 30$. Would I stay here again? YES, for the same rate or cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Bri17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept at the end of a 4 month trip touring over the US and indeed enjoyed my stay. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, all well laid out and indeed very well stocked with loads of pillows and cushions on the bed, mostly I chucked them on the floor to make space for a sleep. Very convenient setup and indeed the staff could not have been more helpful. The staff in the bar were also very good and efficient, however I did not sample the restaurant as i was out most of the time. Only down side is that it is a bit of a walk to the main downtown areas and indeed if you are there for leisure that can be a drawback, but at night with a clear sky the view over parts of the city are indeed worth the wee walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkunkyWunky2
Reviews.Content: This hotel served well while we were there for a conference at the convention center that was 4 blocks away. The walk to most tourist attractions is 20 minutes. The neighborhood is very safe and you mostly see business people walking around that area. The â€œmetroâ€� system is one block over that takes you anywhere you want to go. That was nice having that so close. The staff was very friendly and did a fantastic job assisting us with directions to different areas of town and local things to do. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom. Comfortable king sized bed was nice, pillows could have been better. The fitness area had numerous treadmills, bikes and cross trainers. The lap pool was enough room for 2 people to swim side by side. The only trouble we had was we ran out of soap and shampoo and when we called down to get soap and shampoo brought up to us, it took almost 45 minutes. Besides that, everything was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but overpriced and a bit conceited.”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler057
Reviews.Content: My family and I drove into Boston on a weekend without hotel reservations, and were very surprised that we found immediate availability at this Renaissance. This was our first visit to Boston, and the area certainly looked pretty and clean considering it was right downtown and on the waterfront. We later found out that it was a bit off the "beaten track" but we enjoyed the area and the walk to the shore with it's local businesses. The rooms were quite nice--bright and airy with a great view of the harbor; and the beds were fantastic! The rooms were expensive, but in this case we felt the immediate availability justified the price. As noted by other reviewers, hotel parking and available commercial lots also very high-priced, as was the cost for wireless. After viewing the breakfast choices and prices, we chose to eat all of our meals elsewhere. The front desk staff seemed a bit full of themselves, but we had no problem with service other than a misguided harbor tour on the Spirit of Boston booked by a slightly snooty and misinformed concierge. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but may stay elsewhere the next time we return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny boxes”
Reviews.Author: Northern4370
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business/family trip. I got the room for $150 on Priceline and at that price I was unsatisfied with the room. When housekeeping came by with the crib we requested, we had to all stand in between the beds in order for the gentleman to wheel a tiny folding crib into the room. In the evening we took showers only to find the water-hammer so loud it woke our 2-yr old. The same was repeated in the morning. Throughout the night the air conditioner made a clonking sound that came and went making sleep elusive. As showy as the lobby was, the room was small and unimpressive. Unless you're at a convention I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: bob_96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a relatively "new" section of Boston so the buildings are spaced apart with more greenery than you would expect for Boston. The drawback/advantage (depending on your point of view) is it's somewhat isolated from the other neighborhoods of Boston. We were attending an event at the World Trade Center and there aren't many choices for rooms in this area. We took advantage of a special promotion Renaissance was offering ($50 voucher for future visits and a free companion flight certificate). Getting to the hotel was a challenge as you have to through an extended tunnel to get there and your GPS will be clueless to help. (HINT: Print out directions to the hotel before you leave and give them to your trusty navigator.) We arrived just before 5PM and the desk clerk informed us our room wasn't ready. We had dinner reservations for 5PM so this was a problem. After playing with her computer for what seemed an eternity, we were given our room keys. The lobby has a distinctly modern theme which didn't appeal to us but then it's just our opinion. The room was bright, clean and spacious. We contacted the concierge for local churches offering Sunday services and were given the wrong times. So service is not this hotel's strong suit. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: LilLexy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took a weekend trip to Boston and stayed at this hotel for one night. We drove from New York overnight and arrived in Boston about 7:45 am. Upon arrival I went into the front desk to see if there would be anyway to check into our hotel room early. To our surprise they allowed us to check in eight hours early and gave us a room with was on a higher floor! The room and view was amazing. The room was clean and very nice with an extremely comfortable bed. We were able to shower and start our mini-vaca early which was awesome. I read many reviews after booking that stated the hotel was far away from most attractions. We took taxi's the first day but realized on our walk home that the hotel was only a 20 minute walk from Quincy market and the Warf. We had the calamari and some drinks at the bar and the food was great and so was the bar tender. He was really friendly and gave us some different tips and ideas of where to eat in the city. The parking was somewhat expensive, forty two dollars, but they allowed us to keep our car parked in the garage after check out until almost 6:30 pm for no additional charge. The only downfall, which really wasn't even a downfall, was that the pool was really small and only 3.5 feet deep. Overall we had an amazing experience and would definitely book and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean, nice location, something lacking though...”
Reviews.Author: MGDawg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights and 4 days in Boston as part of a honeymoon trip. Boston the city is incredible and would recommend it to anyone. The Renaissance Boston Waterfront is only 2 years old and is very modern in terms of ammenities and decor. I've had no issues with the staff, they were all quite pleasant and didn't hesitate to show us our available choice of rooms when we checked-in. The room itself was nice and roomy and was nicely furnished. Everything was clean. I wasn't impressed with the fact that wifi internet was not free (and far from being cheap), however, the Starbucks on the lobby floor offers it free of charge. One of the things we didn't like was that the walls seem paper thin. We can hear EVERYTHING that goes on in the hall and were disturbed by the room next door that seemed to be having a party of sorts at 3 in the morning. In a new hotel, you'd expect this to be a little better. We didn't use the swimming pool, but know that it is TINY! It's basically a two lane lap pool. The hotel is nicely situated in an up and coming area, close to an outdoor amphitheatre and the Legal Test Kitchen (for great seafood). It's also right off of the Silver Line for quick access to the T transit system. We walked to downtown a few times and it's a good 20-30 minute walk to get to the popular destinations (Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall, North End). Like many things in Boston, things aren't cheap - parking is one of them. Valet parking at the hotel is $45 I believe, whereas self-parking is $30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: bucktheiguana
Reviews.Content: My room on the 14th floor was functional and afforded a decent view of the harbor and South Boston. The beds were just awesome and incredibly comfortable, especially on my first night coming off of a 15-hour train trip. The room was tastefully decorated in a nautical motif, in keeping with its location near the waterfront. The bar area was very nicely done and the bar staff knew how to mix a good cocktail. The restaurant, 606 Congress, is great for breakfast and dinner, though a bit pricey. My only real complaint about this hotel is that they tend to nickel-and-dime you. If you need headache tablets, it's $1.29 for four. If you want Internet access, it's $13 a day extra. Given that they charge over $200 a night for a room, I think they should include Internet and offer sundry items like headache pills or Alka-Seltzer within reason.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: carlyp
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. The staff are unpleasant and totally unhelpful. The hot water in the shower (there was no bath) did not work so we had to take a stone cold shower. Reception staff didn't even apologise!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, over priced and the worst Marriott stay ever”
Reviews.Author: djandjim
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Reward Members and stay at Marriotts all over the U.S. from Hawaii and Portland OR to Mystic CN and Newport RI. You can't go wrong with Marriotts. The Renaissance on the Waterfront in Boston is the exception. We stayed in a tiny room with no view. The decor in the rooms looks good if you like Elmo, Bert and Ernie, very teenage looking. Upgrades were unavailable and getting late check out was a fight. The staff at the desk and at the bar were snippy and unfriendly, The desk staff told us that it was close to the action. Wrong! Be prepared to pay hefty cab fares. The high points were the bed comfortable) and Winnie the Concierge who was helpful. We stayed in Bar Harbor and Kennebunkport Maine which was totally delightful and then headed to Boston for the final leg. We wished we had left this out.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here beginning on 6/13 for 4 nights. Arrived really early and was surprised and happy to be allowed to check in. Hotel is close to Logan and adjacent to Silver Line stop which made transportation really easy. Room was clean, good daily service, Aveda products. Pool is small but was never crowded...I was there by myself every time. There is a small hot tub too. Lobby bar was busy in the evenings and bartenders were friendly. Food service stopped really early for a bar though.... We booked thru Priceline and got an excellent rate...if that were to happen again I would stay here. Otherwise, I would prefer to be closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dusty, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Kaxmax
Reviews.Content: The location is good if you're going to the convention center or airport, but not for other activities. I travel a *lot* for business and pleasure and this was one of the worst hotels in this price range I have found. It should not be at the star level that it has been granted. The decor and rooms were old - the couch in my room was an allergen pit - I couldn't go near it. The carpet also could use a better vacuuming and/or shampooing. The concierge service was terrible - first we waited in line for 20 minutes behind a single other couple trying to book a trolley tour (not too hard in Boston) - then we were finally served and only needed a rental car - which she could not accomplish. I ended up booking it on my Blackberry as my colleague continued trying to work with her. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, small room, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: Gr8_FamilyAdventures
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'm still glad we stayed in this hotel, but we are fortunate to have received a discounted rate. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could, but can't go all the way to 4 based mostly on the small room size and the fee for internet access from your room--$12 per day. First, details on the positive. I think the beds were nice, good pillows, and everything was clean and well furnished. I used to live in Boston and the location was a plus--some may not think so, but it's really close to downtown and offers plenty of restaurant and bar options within walking distance. Also, in this section of Boston, there is usually meters available. If you are willing to walk a little, and usually awake by 8 am anyway, try to find the 4-hour meters on nearby cross streets. They end at 6 pm and start again 8 am the next day. We did this for 4 nights and avoided the $30/night garage rate (a benefit of this location). About the rooms--we originally reserved a king room with a cot for our daughter. I called once in town and checked in via phone. They said they would have our room ready and bring the cot up. When we arrived, the cot was not in the room, nor do I believe it feasibly would have. We asked if anything larger was available, and ended up with an accessible room with 2 doubles. We are used to a king at home, so this is not the best solution to us. Also, the room still felt cramped for the 3 of us. As for the internet access--we needed to check email and log into a work site for about 10 minutes. It's absurd we would have to pay $12, so instead we tried the business center. Unfortunately, the security settings were set so high that it was impossible to do what we needed to. Per the staffs' suggestion, we tried Starbucks off the lobby, but their access was down (which I learned after buying a cup of coffee just to use the wifi). Later, trying to use the computers at the business center to print our boarding passes, I nearly gave up again due to the million boxes popping up to ask if it was okay to proceed. This "free" internet access option is hardly a good alternative considering the amount of time it will take to accomplish what you set out to do if you are lucky enough to get that far.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejdb
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, new hotel. I travel frequently for work and always stay at Marriott brand hotels and this is by far the nicest I have been to yet. Lovely room with nice views. Just a block or so from the convention center. Crazy-expensive restaurant in the hotel, though - I wouldn't have eaten there if I weren't on business. Not at all a central location for Boston, though, but the location is perfect if you are in town for a conference at the convention center. I am so glad I stayed here and not the conference hotel. I only used the gym once on my last night and I was sorry I hadn't used it every night - it is really nice and looks like a spa.

Reviews.Title: “A fine business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkeith
Reviews.Content: Great for business, very nice rooms, some of the friendliest hotel staff that I've met , fairly new and modern with a restaurant (606) that was definitely a cut above plus easy transport to Logan airport on the silver line. All good but the cons are noted in other reviews- a very good walk to get to downtown and not as many restaurant options as other Boston neighbourhoods. Also the charges for internet access are rather excessive . So a very nice hotel but not the best one as a base for exploring Boston. Recommended provided the location works for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business, not great for families”
Reviews.Author: MurphOC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a convention. IIts about 2 blocks from the hall and about a 10 minute walk. If I came with my family for pleasure, this is not really the place to be. Stay closer to Boston Common or Faneuil Hall. The hotel itself is nice and well kept. I had a handicap room so it was larger with a couch, etc. The gym is great, although they advertise a lap pool which was always full of kids playing. The pool is about 1 meter wide so not too flexible unless you can swim laps early in the AM. Food options are pretty limited in the area unless you jump in a cab or take the subway which is close by. There are a few options closer to the water, but not much. The lobby is small although you can certainly lounge in the cocktail bar area or the restaurant. My only real complaint was that the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and was not handled very well be the staff. The elevators still worked, but no one on staff really knew how to handle or direct the guests. This wasnt very pleasant at 1 in the morning. All in all, I would go back for business in the area, but not pleasure. If you are there for a convention, the Westin is nice and is connected to the convention center so it is definately the closest hotel option with very similar ammenities. Just depends where your loyalties are for points/rewards, etc.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at--hands down”
Reviews.Author: jaynsummer
Reviews.Content: As a meeting planner, I travel a lot. I stayed at this hotel for a week, and not once did I not get top-notch service--every single staffer in the hotel, from the chambermaids, to the window-washer, to the front desk, to the restaurant staff, ALWAYS said hello, how are you, and smiled. Couple that excellent service with a stunning hotel, a super-clean hotel and it all equals an excellent stay. The food in the restaurant is beyond excellent, as is the room service and the food from catering/events. I had a group of over 250 persons at this hotel, and I only got one complaint--the mustard was not French's--it was actually a Sam Adams homemade mustard, with real mustard seeds (yum!) to be used for dipping pretzels in... he didn't like the "fancy city" mustard he said. The hotel manager should be proud of his staff, his hotel's services and the overall image this Renaissance puts forth... hands down, a terrific place, and I would come back again and again. I totally, whole-heartedly reccomend this hotel to other planners, corporations, business travelers and leisure travelers. One nice thing to note... this hotel could not be any easier to get to from the airport (via Silver Line to Silver Line Way stop) and you can get right from the hotel to the rest of the T system. EXCELLENT location, safe neighborhood, and stunning views!

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jcw721
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights recently because I was attending a conference at the convention center. If I had it to over I would stay elsewhere.. It was overpriced for what it is and what they give. If you need to be near the convention center, the options are limited and the hotel knows this. So, the charges are high. I think a more central hotel would be a better idea. After hours there is nothing around the hotel and youâ€™ll need to take the T into Boston or end up with a boringish walk into town. After a screw up on their part they upgraded me to a better room and free breakfast in their lounge. Even my upgraded room wasnâ€™t that great. The hotel is billed as water front but the hotel is really only facing the water on the short end not full on so the best youâ€™ll get is partial view of the water. There arenâ€™t all that many rooms that have even that. There is a whole wing of the hotel which faces the back and has no view whatsoever. The breakfast which I got for free because of their screw up was nice but should have come with all rooms at the rates they charge. Oddly, the hotel does not offer the breakfast on Saturday or Sunday. I am not sure why. So, the last morning of my stay there was no free breakfast. The walls of the hotel, like most, are super thin. I heard the tvs of both rooms next to mine and every word of the cell phone conversations of these rooms as well. Finally, hereâ€™s the most amazing thing, even though the hotel charged over 200 a night, they still charged 16 a day extra for internet access. Actually there is a 13 a night plus tax for semi fast internet and 16 plus tax for the faster internet. This to me is appalling. It brings new meaning to the term nickel and diming. All of the hotels near the convention center charged this extra rate for internet. The front desk clerk failed to tell me that the starbucks in the lobby gives their internet away for free. So if you stay here you can go to the lobby for free internet. They wonâ€™t tell you this. This place basically is a rip off. Too high priced, and then looking for extra money in things they should provide for free. Better value can be found in a more central location. If you must stay here make sure you try to get a room with a semi view or youâ€™ll be stuck looking at the T sliver line tracks in a hotel that has water front in the name. Also, beware the not free internet. Lastly, the front desk will steer you to park at the apartment building next door for 30 a night but there is public lot next to the hotel on the other side which charges 10 a night. They will not tell you about that lot. Again, they are not helpful and probably get a cut from that higher priced parking. i'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “New Stylish Hotel - Great Views, Not So Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StickerShock
Reviews.Content: We got a great low rate on this hotel via an Internet site. The hotel is only two years old and still looks and feels very new. It is located in the completely renovated Seaport/Waterfront district of South Boston. It is only a few blocks from the new convention center, the federal courthouse, the Institute of Contemporary Art, and the design center. The silver line of the T is across the street. Unfortunately, the neighborhood is T or cab ride away from almost everything else in Boston. Look on a map before you decide to stay in South Boston. In a few years, it will probably be very trendy with more restaurants, bars, and apartments. As for the hotel itself, it has a real Starbucks in the lobby, a terrific concierge named Peggy, and an extremely friendly front desk staff. The beautiful shallow pool, whirlpool, and fitness center is in a secluded section of the fifth floor. Hallways and rooms have a modern, nautical design. rooms are extremely comfortable, airy, and clean. Our view was of the financial district as well as the water. Ask for a high floor with a view and you will not be disappointed. We self-parked in an underground garage in a new apartment building adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Actually pretty convenient if you know your way around”
Reviews.Author: snowshoe_bunnie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel might be a little out of the way, but it's a short, direct ride from Logan airport on the Silver Line buses. And if you want to go downtown, you can catch the Silver Line again to South Station and change trains there. The services will run till around midnight. Since this hotel is quite newly opened, everything is very clean and in good condition. Rooms are spacious and have a wave/waterfront theme. I was given a room facing downtown and the World Trade Centre on the waterfront. Nice views. Room cleaning service could do better though, as used towels and amenities were not replaced with a complete set and the bathroom mat was missing the next day after room was made. But overall room was still very clean. Liked this hotel very much but very pricey! Although to be fair, hotels of this caliber in Boston would all cost around the same prices albeit at more convenient locations too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy, romantic, and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: havecurveswilltravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I bid on a room in the Boston south/seaport area on Priceline. We won the Renaissance Boston Waterfront for $80/night (Thursday-Sunday). I was extremely pleased with the hotel. The lobby is very modern and pretty. When we first checked in, the agent at the desk advised us that they did not have a king waterfront view available for us, which we understood. We got to our room on the 10th floor and found it had a view of the high rise next door. We also found that the deadbolt did not work. We called the front desk immediately and were moved up to room #1503, a king room with a waterfront view. We were a little confused as we were told 10 minutes earlier that no waterfront king rooms were available. The room was beautiful. I have zero complaints about the room. The bathroom shower was lovely (walk in with full length glass doors). We enjoyed the large flat screen tv and the big picture window that gave us a full view of the city, and of the waterfront. We used the hotel jacuzzi and pool twice and really enjoyed them. We never ate at the the hotel but did go next door to The Legal Test Kitchen on our first afternoon and had a wonderful lunch. Valet parking and internet are expensive, but consider this the cost of staying at a beautiful hotel in Boston proper. You are likely to find similar costs at any 3, 4, or 5 star hotel in a big city. We asked for late checkout on the Sunday as our flights were not until late afternoon. The hotel allowed us until 1 pm. A very nice gesture. In previous reviews, I did see others mention that the walls were thin. I only experienced a noise concern on our last morning at the hotel. And to say it was a concern is really a stretch. If I was very quiet, and had the TV on mute, I could hear the couple in the room next to us. But under no circumstances was it disruptive or loud. My one complaint (which is my complaint at any hotel) is that hotel rooms are never cool enough. I am a cold sleeper and the first thing I do in any hotel room is turn the temperature down to 65F or so. I still don't generally find this cool enough as there is almost always a lack of circulation in a hotel room. This is the second city in which my boyfriend and I have ventured out to a Walmart to purchase a fan. Seems silly, I know, but I am a very particular sleeper and I don't sleep well at all without good, cool air circulation. It would be great if hotels kept a fan available. All in all, a wonderful 3 nights/4 days in Boston at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront. P.S. Bring or rent a navigation system if you are visiting Boston and are unfamiliar with the city. Boston is truly a maze. You will most assuredly get lost at least once. A navigation system will get you back on track more quickly than if you are just using your own sense of direction.

Reviews.Title: “Horizontal Snow!”
Reviews.Author: MimiCardiff
Reviews.Content: This was a long weekend break from the UK (...in December !! ... yes I know). Booked as a late deal with Expedia this was my first holiday with my new man and I wanted to introduce him to a city that I love :0) The Hotel was fantastic, reception staff smile and talk to you like a human being. Concierge were very helpful and friendly, even offering us an umbrella when we ventured out to Quincy Market in the snow! The bar staff make a wicked Mango Mojito at the very open and informal bar. Bar snacks were tasty and plentiful and the restaurant served great food ( even if the decor was like a scene from the Waltons. Some might say cozy and snug.) I would recommend this hotel, but compare the holiday market sites as booking direct with the hotel is not cheap. ( I got a bargain from the UK booking with Expedia.) Back to the horizontal snow :0), I have never seen snow fall like it.
