The wind certainly blows in this part of town, but there are always very friendly cabbies happy to take you to wheere ever you want to go. All in all a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with reasonabe value”
Reviews.Author: NYHammer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not quite in the middle of downtown, but very cose to the Silver bus line that takes you into the city. I came with my family for New Years and I chose it because it was close to the children's museum where my kids spent a good deal of their time. The breakfast was your standard fare for a full service hotel, but well executed. Overall I recommend it as long as you don't have to be right in the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way location, beautiful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: EMEDCt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and were pleased with the accomodations. Positives: beautiful view from room, both harbor and city views, nice lap pool, huge sauna, fitness center was great, nice amenities, staff was really friendly, concierge very accomodating. Negatives: pricey room, bar drinks were expensive, beds were uncomfortable, far from everything. No impulsive trip to kill time at Quincy Market, or the North End, both are a $ 7-8 cab ride away. Only close places are Legal Test Kitchen, and long waits for tables at local restaurants. About 5 blocks to the Convention Center, also quite a walk to the nearest Dunkin'.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelplus
Reviews.Content: This is a well run, well maintained contemporary hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Gfinn524
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few hotels in Boston, and the Renaissance is one of my favorites. The business lounge is great, the staff is friendly and helpful, and although they originally messed up our room arrangements, they immediately fixed the problem and treated us to a wonderful fruit plate. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, and the restaurant downstairs is wonderful. I've stayed there three times and I'm sure I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WhiteElephant1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We had two rooms, and arrived late from an international flight. We had very nice rooms, the connection with the Silver Line is super easy from Logan Airport and we had a lovely, quick dinner at the restaurant. One thing I would like to add is that the breakfast buffet is wonderful! Dont miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGerm
Reviews.Content: First of all, the view was very nice. From the harbour, I had a "city view" and even though I was only on the 8th floor, it was exceptional. What a nice city! The hotel is located right on the tour bus line, and for 7$ per person, you take the bus for the day, and it brings you back (every 20 min). The downtown area is only 20 minutes walk if it's a nice day... The building is new and very elegant. I read a review that said that the beds were stiff. Whatever. They are very nice. On the negative side: it is pricey. Even though I got a deal because I paid with AMEX (50$ off), it is still expensive. Don't forget that valet parking is 41$ per day... There are some other parking lots near the hotel if you don't want to pay too much. They range from 10 to 50$.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, uncomfy bed”
Reviews.Author: stonyMD
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful and modern hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. I liked our room except for the double bed which was too firm and uncomfortable to sleep on. Otherwise, the location is great....a few blocks to the Convention Center and World Trade Center for meetings. South Station is within walking distance. Starbucks is also conveniently located in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: avaree
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference and would definitely stay again, even for a personal trip. The rooms are clean and bright and the signature Marriott beds are heavenly. The staff was top-notch as well. The location isnâ€™t right in the heart of everything, but it was an easy and scenic 20 minute walk to the Aquarium and Quincy Market. Also a quick and easy trip from the airport on the Silver Line for only a couple of bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: What a great location - only a few minutes from the airport by Silverline, and a 15 minute walk to Boston's sights. Ask for a room on a high floor with harbour view - even if, like me, you booked with Priceline. I paid only $80 per night for a weekend stay - you can't get a cheap motel for that! The room was very comfortable - and Starbucks internet password worked on the 17th floor in my room too! I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “You have to think first!!!”
Reviews.Author: Onthelook
Reviews.Content: When you travel to a big city in the US, Boston, NYC, Atlanta, Chicago, you should expect to pay a lot for parking. That's how it is everywhere. Full Service hotels do charge for parking. Everybody that travels should all do their own research first. Don't go to a hotel expecting the concierge to pull from a hat everything you can do in a city. Travel with at least an idea of what you want. One last thing, I know that Priceline is very popular these days and everybody can get good prices at upscale hotels, but since these rates are very discounted, at times you might not get the room that you want. Priceline never garantees a room with a king bed for example with the best view possible. If you chose to book with Priceline, you have to go prepared to what the hotels has to offer. If you want a nice hotel witha nice room and view, so pay the regular price like a lot of us do. Overall, great hotel and I would definitely stay here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Weekend - Renaissance Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Swampy3
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Renaissance, and for the low (Priceline) price it was a great value. It has good access to the airport and to the subway system (Silver Line), but really you can easily walk into the downtown area in about 15 minutes. Nice colorful decor, staff was helpful. They gave us an early check-in, which helped us greatly. Double beds are on the small side, so ask for a king if you can.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: McBerr
Reviews.Content: To start off, we would not stay here if we were paying regular price. Like most upscale brands, many things are not included in your stay. The hotel was definitely NEW, very clean and chic. The staff were... snobby to say the least, but it is Boston, so that is to be expected. Parking is a pain, since the hotel does not have its own parking lot, one has to park next door, 30 dollars a day. If you want the valet, it is 41 dollars a day. A little high, wouldn't you say?! The concierge was useless, you could probably get more information from the internet online. The hotel is what it is, nothing too special about it that really stands out. The location was decent, you could walk to dt in 15 mins or so, and bus connection is literally outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “A happy stay”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline99
Reviews.Content: I was so glad that I chose the Renaissance Boston Waterfront, after indecision concerning another hotel. I found a very good senior rate on the Marriott.com they do drop their prices once in awhile, it was probably a Labor Day special or something. My view was beautiful, the staff were very gracious and accomodating, and the hotel is very airy and fresh. I did not know that the silver line is so close to the hotel, and this was extremely nice since it comes right out of the bus or train station and your there in no time. I also liked the fact that the convention center area is more quiet and open. I am a fuss budget when it comes to clean rooms, so my complaints would not be fair, I cleaned my own window so I could see that sunset without a smudge. Will stay there again, Thank you Marriot for a happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: kbiviano
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Renaissance this week. Got an unbeatable rate through priceline. We wanted to stay in the Waterfront area as it was convenient to where my friend was staying while in Boston for a work trip. Hotel is clean and new...so are the rooms. The thing that really blew me away was the service of the entire staff. Absolutely FANTASTIC! The valet/bellhop staff were most especially helpful and courteous. Front desk staff was wonderful as well. I was traveling with two young children, and as such had quite a bit of "gear" with me. Everyone was quick to help me with whatever I needed. A couple negatives though... * If you are looking to sightsee in Boston (which we were not), this area is a good walk from most of the places you'd want to visit. * Hotel parking is expensive...$41/night for overnight guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with an awesome breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: eye7eye
Reviews.Content: nice comfortable rooms, good size gym with good equipment. the breakfast is amazing! try the lobster omelettes! very convenient if you need a hotal close to the conference centre! i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scooterchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront hotel during our stay in Boston while we did some looking around for our March wedding - we stayed in their Executive King Suite. The room was fabulous! It was huge - a large living room w/HD flat screen TV, large window with view, nice kind bedroom with another HD TV and a walk-in closet! The bathroom was oversized with two sinks seperated by pocket door! We ate at the restaurant downstairs, 606 Congress and enjoyed the food and atmosphere - the service from all staff was 5 star all around - a great stay, good location and the silverline stop is right outside the door of the hotel - jump on that and your on your way to the subway connections downtown and beyond! Thanks to Lindsay and Karen for setting up our stay - ya'll rock!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Theater and Fun”
Reviews.Author: opal91086
Reviews.Content: Out of the way hotel - maybe, near to everything. Large rooms, very clean. Nice staff at the front desk, the dining room (brunch for $19 includes choice of lobster meat or crab in you omelette) and bar. My advice - this out of the way place is the place to be! FYI, reserved on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “They are Socialists”
Reviews.Author: a_good_night_sleep
Reviews.Content: When I pulled to the front door, the valet spilled water onto my laptop computer. He did not apologize and was interested in a tip. The tip is, "Be more careful". The security wanted to take my beer away. The hotel manager said the MA laws prohibits alcohol in the room. Needless to say, they will provide room service with beer/wine. Sticky candy was in the carpet. They ruined my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Out of the Way Location”
Reviews.Author: WatsonTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for us by a bride and groom whose wedding was nearby. The accomodations seemed fine but we did not receive room service one of the days. After 14 hours of site seeing we came home to dirty dishes outside the room and dirty towels on the floor. The front desk credited us $50 for our trouble but it does not seem adequate but we were too tired to put up a fight. The hotel was convienent for a wedding on the pier but that was about it. It was 1.5 mile walk to do any of the major sight seeing unless you were catching a boat somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This is how a Hotel is supposed to be run!”
Reviews.Author: CrankyOldBear
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, great rooms, and the most polite staff you could ask for. Expensive yes, but what place that you would want to stay in isn't? The resturant features some delicious fare that was really well prepared and presented..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyonTime
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new. The lobby is stylish and inviting. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was a nice size with new linens, decor and furniture. The room and bathroom were spotless. The hotel location is a good 20 minute walk to downtown which was nice in the summer but might not be ideal in winter. There is not too much to do in the immediate area around the hotel which is near the harbor. If in the area I would recommend eating at the Legal Seafood Test Kitchen which is next door to the hotel. Only a few minor points against... The internet acess was expensive and the room service menu was lacking. On one night a concert was at the nearby amphitheater and I was suprised how loud the music could be heard in the room. Overall I had a nice stay at the hotel and would stay here for business again.

Reviews.Title: “Just for business trip - nothing else”
Reviews.Author: dpmela
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week there, due to conference. Rooms are spacious and clean but very expensive. Room design is not that exciting, quite simple and rather old fashioned. The big problem is you can hardly rest without ear plugs, the walls are so thin that you can hear nearly everything going on around, even when your neighbour showers or flush the toilette. Service is standard, not extraordinary, rather cool. Location is far from activities, going out for food is quite a walk away. If you take T, you need to change a few times. I would recommend this hotel only if you need to go to WTC daily, otherwise don't.

Reviews.Title: “Very New - Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: gdlstx
Reviews.Content: This was a brand new property at the time of stay and in typical Marriott/Renaissance fashion, they did not disappoint. The lobby is nice and modern, and the entire building was very clean. All rooms are non-smoking which is a major plus. Rooms are also spacious, and the beds are extremely comfortable... very hard to crawl out of them in the a.m. Restrooms are immaculate. The pool, spa, and fitness center are top notch and the staff is always friendly. With regard to location, there isn't much in the immediate area as this area is still developing. However, if you don't mind a 15-20 minute (uncomplicated) stroll you'll find yourself within reach of Faneuil Hall and the North End. Otherwise, a cab ride will run about $5. Noteworthy is the metro stop just across the side street of the hotel which will take you directly to the airport terminals. Overall, great stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern and great food”
Reviews.Author: Hamiwinks
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Renaissance Boston and would have liked to stay more if not for the food (weird) but no time! You are out of the city itself but it's not too long a walk back in if you are active and it's nice being by the harbour. The rooms are spacious, beds great, bathroom good and service as you would expect from this level of hotel. But be warned if driving....the parking fee is the most ferocious I have ever struck (yes, a sheltered lifestyle), at $42 US a night!! We were lured into eating at the hotel restaurant (usually would go where the locals are) by our lovely Irish bar attendant who simply advised us to watch the dishes being carried past into the dining area, and then watch the people as they ate......so we became dining room stalkers, (a new and disturbing pastime), for a while and then went into the restaurant to try our luck. And we are so glad we did. The freshest produce cooked to an exacting standard (as advised by one of my party who is a restaurant manager) and everydish surpassed expectation. Nearly had one of the best meals in a long time in a hotel restaurant....should I eat out more or increase my medication?.....maybe both, but I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “new, updated, stylish decor, immaculately clean and inviting”
Reviews.Author: redryderent
Reviews.Content: I had a client perform at Bank of America Pavilion (1/4 mile away). This hotel must be nearly brand-new. Very stylish and tasteful rooms. Great bathroom with excellent fixtures and water pressure. Sweet-smelling natural toiletries. Not a stain on the rug or bed. Nothing broken, chipped or moldy. Efficient and enjoyable all-around. $90 on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel in wlking distance to Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: tommy135
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, the rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. Had a view of the bay from my room. A 7-11 and Dunkin Donuts are 5 minutes away. You can walk in 15 minutes to downtown Boston, it takes about 20 minutes to the aquarium. If the weather is nice it's a good location. The silver line T stop is 1,5 blocks away. Would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, serene location, easy access”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the airport, convention center and downtown and has a lovely waterfront location. Okay, I'm slightly influenced by the fact that I snagged this hotel for under $100 on Priceline for a holiday Saturday night stay but this is still a great hotel and new at that. It's not in the heart of Boston, so if you're looking for that, move on. I'm also a walker so I don't mind walking a little to get to the restaurants and bars nearby (yes there are several on Atlantic). Faneuil Hall and the North End were also walkable from here but about 20-30 mins walk so if you can't handle that, take a cab or the subway. Rooms were clean, comfortable and had a very nice flat panel tv (about 37", I think). I received a corner room with a "peek-around" harbor view so it was quiet and nice. The beds here are very comfortable and once you sink into one it's hard to come out. I had little interaction with the staff but what interaction I had was always pleasant, friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again----but only on that P-line rate because I can't afford the regular rates. :)

Reviews.Title: “Many +'s, a few -'s”
Reviews.Author: myni
Reviews.Content: For the most part, the hotel is great. It is certainly an above average 4 star hotel. It is new, clean, and very comfortable. The rooms have extremely large flat screen TV's, and the bathrooms are very nice. If you don't like lots of bright colors, especially orange and blue, than the decor may be somewhat disappointing. The hotel is pretty close to the scenic (although somewhat fishy smelling) waterfront, with views of Logan Airport (not very loud though). This proximity brings with it an advantage - if you wish to skip over the outrageously priced, although chic hotel restaurant, Legal Seafood (which started in Boston) has it's "test restaurant" right next door. As far as proximity to downtown Boston, it is an easy .5 mile or so walk. The hotel is near a conference center, and the neighborhood is moderatly desireable.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Points and Some Not So Good Points...”
Reviews.Author: SueFee
Reviews.Content: I wish Marriott would be more consistent. Renaissance and JW Marriott are supposed to be their top of the line hotels. Yet some Renaissances and JW Marriotts are not 4-diamond properties. Such is the case with this Renaissance. It is rated as a 3-diamond property, and it's easy to see why, too. For example, the selection of free toiletries isn't as large as what is found in the 4-diamond properties. Plus the typical room doesn't have a tub---just a shower stall. In addition, the towels are not as thick and plush as what is typically expected in Renaissances. If Marriott wants customers to think of Renaissances and JW Marriotts as their top brands, then they need to consistently provide 4-diamond amenities. All that said (and not as a complaint but rather to point out the differences), the hotel was kept very clean. The decor is stylish. The rooms are on the small side but still manageable for two people. One thing I did really like---there is a small refrigerator in each room. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean. However, they were very slow to get around to our room. One day we were even considering calling the front desk because we didn't think they were going to come. However, we found that they tended to get to the room between 4 and 5 p.m. There is one thing that is done by housekeeping that we found impressive---when the maid was in a room, she would put a sign by the door saying that housekeeping was in the room and if you wanted to enter while the maid was there, you would have to show her your room key. We were given a room on the 16th floor that had great views of the Harbor and Back Bay. I liked that there was a daybed by the window. It was really pleasant to sit there and enjoy the view. Before our stay here, Marriott Rewards bumped us up to Gold Level. That means we got to have a free continental breakfast in the concierge lounge. Unfortunately, it was only available Monday through Friday. However, it was better than the average continental breakfast in that it offered scrambled eggs in addition to the fruits and pastries. When the concierge lounge didn't have breakfast, we ate at the hotel restaurant, 606 Congress, which offers a breakfast buffet until noon on the weekends. The location of the hotel has its plusses and minuses. On the plus side---there is very little traffic on the roads so it made the area very pedestrian-friendly. The hotel is right next to the Silver Line Way stop which made getting there from Logan very easy. Also, it made getting downtown and elsewhere easy, too. Plus, by the World Trade Center there is a 7-11 which came in handy for buying cold drinks for the fridge. The area is quiet at night so it is easy to get some sleep (all things being equal). On the minus side---the hotel is a good 15 to 20 minute walk to downtown so you can't just leave your room to shop or have a meal then easily get back to drop off your shopping bags or rest for a while. You're pretty much left with carrying your shopping bags around with you or taking the Silver Line back to the hotel. Depending on just where you are, it could involve making one or two changes of subway lines. Like many hotels, the walls are thin. If you have quiet neighbors, it isn't a problem. However, for a couple of nights we had noisy neighbors who had a toddler that cried a lot. It made me glad I brought my earplugs. We also didn't like the shower stall very much. There was little room to put items such as shampoo. The grab bar was in the back of the stall, opposite the faucet and showerhead. I would imagine it would be difficult for anyone who needs the grab bar to use it. Also, after showering, when you open the door, lots of water spills out onto the floor. Would we stay here again? Well...the verdict is still out on that one. What drew us here is that it was far cheaper than the Marriotts that are downtown or in the Back Bay, plus the proximity to the Silver Line. Yet we like the idea of a hotel that is in a better location for sightseeing and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, GREAT service - I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: chapetx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a year old and is beautiful. It's modern and clean. The rooms are a nice size and comfortable. The service was great. This is one of the best experience I've had at a hotel in a while. The one downside is there isn't that much to do in a walking distance but that didn't bother me as we had a car and public transportation is near by!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location no problem”
Reviews.Author: FGCESQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and son over Spring Break, and it turned out to be a very nice hotel. It is new and beautiful. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Our room was large and had a view of the city and water. The pool and gym were nice. The lobby with fireplace and free computer use is very nice. When I booked the hotel, I was worried about the location, but it turns out that the Waterfront is beautiful, full of first class hotels and restaurants, and the subway "T" silver line is across the street from the hotel, an easy trip to downtown Boston. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Miopyk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late in the afternoon on a Saturday and straight away you could tell that these guys knew how to make their guests feel welcome. The valet service and bell stand were very efficient and professional and the check in staff were exactly the same. We were upgraded to an executive room without any prompting from us which was very nice. We had dinner in the restaurant that evening and both the food and service were first class. Breakfast was the same and the choice was very good. The location of the hotel is about half a mile from the downtown area but there is a bus stop over the road which links to the rest of the transportation system which we thought was very efficient. We spent the day wandering around Boston and did the historic walk which shows you most of the key sites in the guide books. We used room service that evening and again the food and service was excellent. The room itself was very modern with a large HD LCD TV and the bed was very comfortable. Overall we enjoyed our stay alot and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The hotel was very comfortable and the staff were fantastic which I guess makes it a winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel.... but unsafe housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: mrbuckwas
Reviews.Content: my $200 sunglasses were stolen from the room and when I called to report it nothing was done by management... nice hotel but valueables might be unsafe in rooms....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jml3188
Reviews.Content: The staff here has been amazing! From check in to bar and 606 Congress restaurant, everyone has been fantastic. This is a Ritz-level Marriott and I would stay here over and over. Spacious rooms and great amenities and the best shower in town!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for conferences, not for the city”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: Freshly refurbished, close to the conference centre and World Trade Centre. Nice clean rooms, staff were helpful and a new bar opened during my stay. Staff are still getting used to the new layout, but it's a nice palce for a drink. Recommnded (better than the Seaport) for a conference. It's a 20-30 minute walk into the city though, no real hardship but a taxi may be advisable late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: caseyguillot
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very nice and spacious. Hotel staff were very good about giving directions, and one of them even gave me an umbrella to use while it rained. There was plenty of comfortable furniture on which to rest. The lobby restaurant had a great breakfast buffet ($20 for an array of tasty food). The rooms were well-equipped with many items a traveler may need, including iron, ironing board, hair dryer, etc. The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were squeaky clean and always stocked with towels, soap, and shampoo. We even had a third bed brought to us in the room for free because a colleague's flight was cancelled, and he need somewhere to sleep. Overall, a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed - great getaway”
Reviews.Author: caroline_krby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Valentine's day and were very impressed. Booked on priceline (name your own price) for $100, very good deal. The valet is $41 but the garage is right there so your better off parking and just pay $27 for the night. We arrived around 2pm and had no problem getting an early check-in. The staff was very accomodating. We had requested a king bed and harbor view, but they were not able to accomodate our entire request. The front desk explained it was busy due to the holiday but that they could still offer us a king bedroom without a view or we could have a double room with a view. We went with the double room and view and were not disappointed. When we arrived in the room we were so impressed with the beautiful decor and cleanliness. The 37 inch flat screen tv was great. The view was of part of south Boston and also of the harbor. It was a beautiful day and we could see all the sailboats. The double beds were not a problem, extremely comfortable. We grabbed a late-night bite at the hotel restaurant bar and the service and food was excellent! Over-all very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance- Great”
Reviews.Author: hogtied79
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay here. Room modern and large. Bed and linens great. Beautiful flat screen. Staff truly wonderful and there was nothing that they would not do. The negatives: Walls are very thin, and could hear the people in the next room talking, and the TV sound apparent. Parking, at $41, extremely expensive for this area. Another issue is location. Fine for me, but if someone wants a "night on the town", too far to walk anywhere. Would definitely stay again, primarily due to the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very chic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: FMUBSU
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is in a great location. It is right by the airport but is slightly off the beaten track where the traffic and noise are very tolerable. It is surrounded by great restaurants and upscale condos and office buildings. It is just a few blocks from the subway as well. The hotel is clean, modern and chic. The rooms are pretty cramped which is not uncommon for a big East Coast city. While we were there, there was a huge singles convention, so it was not exactly peaceful and quiet. The walls are paper thin and the sound insulation is somewhat lacking. However, the service is friendly, prompt and professional. The gym is well done but very hot! There is a small pool. If you want a new, trendy clean hotel in a great location, you would be hard pressed to find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I stayed at this hotel. Off the beaten track a little but with 2 housekeeping svs a day, great linens, comfortable rooms and club floor - that's all I needed. Once in a while you hear the planes but not really bothersome. There are a number of good restaurants within a short cab ride. Remember this is near water and does not have the same atmosphere and shopping as the other areas of Boston. You would use a cab or if you are so inclined the subway is just a short walk away. As a hotel this was first rate and I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel and Cool area”
Reviews.Author: micheleg
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, cool decor &very helpful concierge. Good location for Contemporary Museum and pick up for Super Trolley Tour. Parking $41 per night. Great for Girls Getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Great Room, Exceptional Staff, Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: BeanieM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business in early October & found hotel to be really comfortable and very clean. Here is an overview: PROS: -95% of staff I encountered from desk to room service were professional, courteous, informed -Large, comfortable lounging settee in front of large window -Bed linens & mattress are FANTASTIC!! Slept like a newborn baby -Meticulously clean -42" LCD TV that turns to anywhere in the room -GREAT lighting from dim/mood to bright in all areas of room -Large glass shower (no tub) w/great water pressure & temp -Room Service friendly, good food, reasonable price -Excellent onsite restaurant & Starbucks in lobby -Fresh smelling & quiet CONS: -Location is a bit more businessy than touristy (not seedy or scary area) but taxis available continuously, Silver Line (bus) & subway both less than a block away -No airport shuttle yet very close to Logan Tips if you aren't using a rental car: Buy a $2.00 ticket at MBTA machine in baggage claim area of airport or pay on the bus. Go to the RIGHT END of walk at arrivals (each terminal) & wait for long double bus, the Silver Line. It's only 2 bucks and the 2nd stop is right at the Renaissance (Silver Line Way stop). Taxi price: Hotel to Mass General/Shriners Burn Hosp: approx 8 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern hotel in good (but not great) location”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights attending a conference in the hotel. Got a special conference rate of about $200 plus tax. Although the location was not bad, I would likely consider a downtown hotel if going to Boston just as a tourist, especially if the rate at the Renaissance were much more than we paid. As noted, the hotel is not real close to a lot of attractions, though it is within easy walking distance (across a parking lot and street) to the Silver Line bus/trolley, which can connect you go the airport or the regular subway lines. Breakfast option of Starbucks has been noted, though they seemed to have nothing but pastries. You can get fast food breakfast sandwiches a 5 plus minute walk away at Dunkin Donuts. For dinner, there is the restaurant/bar in the lobby (limited menu), and, nearby, the seafood and Italian restaurants noted in other reviews, plus the funky No Name Restaurant at the nearby Fish Pier, the small and casual Yankee Lobster Pot down the street, upscale Morton's Steak House, and others if you walk further. Still, if the weather is bad you may not enjoy the walking required. The rooms are modern and spacious. No complaints at all, other than the lack of room safes. Ours had a nice view of the harbor (be sure to request in advance). The business center had two PCs for customer use (free). Exercise room was adequate; pool small (narrow). Concierge was quite helpful in giving info about tourist sites, subways, etc. And there was an endless supply of mini Reese's Peanut Butter Cups at the check-in counters.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Nice Area and Some Tips for travellers Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Chulolaw
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Priceline and at first i was a bit apprehensive because the parking was so horribly expensive. I went for a weekend and thought from the other reviews that the area was abandoned at night. It was not. Parking is ample at night but you must pay the meters $1.00 per hour at 8am, Although I like sleeping in, I got up and moved the car over 2 blocks to ample parking lots for $5.00 per day weekend if no events are going on. It was $5.00 although u must pay by credit card. It was great. The old town trolley stops near Anthony's pier which was easy walking distance to do the trolley ride. The Hotel is brand new and amazing. Very clean, nice tv's, excellent bar and restaurant and great staff. The trolley driver dropped us off in front of the hotel because Tropical Storm Hanna decided to pour down on us so for our benefit and some of the older passengers he made a special stop and avoided our need to walk 2 blks in the torrential rain. Hotel is near the waterfront, near the convention center and near the Fannueil Hall, (about a 15 min walk) You can easily take the silver line from the Airport to the Hotel and it is on the next block that the train is there. I would have preferred not to have a vehicle because parking where all the clubs and bars are is awful and hard to find. I think you can take the silver line to South Station and transfer to the rest of the T, which I would definitely do next time. Airport by car is on the other side of the New Tunnel and it is a 10 min drive. Very nice, quiet area. Starbucks is in the lobby for a morning coffee and danish. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again, so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise convenience”
Reviews.Author: Mary47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in August, with a late arrival, on the eve of a cruise departing from the Black Falcon Terminal. The hotel is lovely, the desk personnel helpful, and the room extremely comfortable. We were able to walk over to the cruise ship terminal in the late morning. It was a warm day but even with luggage it was not difficult. We booked through Priceline and were extremely pleased at the value we obtained.

Reviews.Title: “noisy - no thanks”
Reviews.Author: reymax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in between trans-atlantic flights so wanted somewhere quiet. There was a concert on the waterfront which went on until midnight (not the hotel's fault - granted), however the walls were thin and neighbours were noisy. Room light and spacious but would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel; needs some fine-tuning”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Boston Waterfront hotel for two nights in September while attending a conference. Thereâ€™s a lot to recommend about this hotel, as well as a few drawbacks. Itâ€™s new (opened in February 2008) and it looks it. Most everything is shiny, polished, and not showing any wear, which is as it should be. Thereâ€™s a â€œwater themeâ€� throughout, with lots of blues and greens in the color scheme in common areas and the guest rooms. Itâ€™s convenient to Logan Airport, easily accessible by the Silver T line, and just two blocks from the World Trade Center stop. Front desk personnel were gracious and efficient. Upon check-in, I was initially given a room with two queen beds although I had requested a king, and put on a lower floor near the elevator. I immediately went back to the front desk and I was moved to a room on a higher floor away from the elevator, though they still had no king rooms available. I questioned this, as I was checking in about 4 p.m. -- neither early nor late â€“ but was told there simply were no king rooms available. When paying $249 a night, not getting what one requested is more difficult to accept than if Iâ€™d obtained a deeply discounted rate from a booking service. The on-site restaurant â€“ 606, for the hotelâ€™s address â€“ is described as an â€œAmerican tappasâ€� restaurant. The dinner menu features six categories ranging from salads and appetizers to main courses to a selection of cheeses. The food is very good and the variety excellent. 606 also has a pretty decent wine list. But the service needs some improvement. Most of the wait staff I saw was quite young and, while they seated me, took my order, and delivered my food quickly, they didnâ€™t check back to see if I needed anything until I had finished the food. That area should be targeted for improvement. Housekeeping could also use some fine-tuning. When attending a conference, I HATE coming back to the room after lunch and finding it had still not been made up, so I called at 8 a.m. just before I left and requested service. When I returned at 1 p.m., it still had not been done. I find that very frustrating, especially since Iâ€™d requested service five hours earlier. The hotel has a well-equipped fitness center with individual TVs on the cardio equipment, as well as a pool and (usually) saunas for both men and women. The menâ€™s sauna was out of order during my stay, which is unfortunate for such a new facility. Guest rooms are nicely furnished and offer full connectivity (for a fee); they include large, flat-screen TVs (HBO and other movie channels included) which can also be hooked to your computer and doubles as a monitor; and iHome radios by the bed. However, the rooms do lack a few things. There are no in-room safes, which I find very useful when traveling with my laptop. It could also have used a table and chair in addition to the desk; otherwise, any in-room dining would have to be eaten at the desk or on the bed. And the towels are far too thin considering the higher-end nature of this property. All in all, a pleasant stay and a hotel I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: SteveBoston
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel in the waterfront area. It's about twenty minutes from the center of the city on the subway. The rooms are a decent size and very comfortable. The walls might be on the thin side, but I did not have a problem with noise. Check in took less than one minute. The subway is a block away, and the hotel is convenient to the airport and the train and bus stations. The TV was great, HD. The shower was the usual new low flow design but nice. There was a peanut on the floor from a previous occupant, but the room seemed very clean in general. I would not pay $400.00 a night. That must be for someone on a expense account, but I got a very good rate. I would definitely stay there again. I was on the ninth floor and had a bit of a view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent views, easy location for transport network”
Reviews.Author: sibboinwales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Renaissance over a weekend between business trips and found the hotel to be well placed for "doing Boston". The hotel is new, well designed and equipped. Views are excellent (try to get a room as high as possible) and rooms are light, airy, great air con, big tv and a really good clock radio that I could plug my iPod straight into. There was a conference on at the hotel the whole weekend I was there but other than some busy lifts this did not bother me in the least. Bar was good for snacks and drinks and as a lone traveller I found it a nice area to relax, have a beer and chill / read! Food is dear but then you are in a city etc. The hotel is away from the main drag but is a 2 minute walk away from the World Trade Centre T station. Tip: if you are there for a weekend, get a 3 day ticket as it just makes it easier to jump on and off. Within a day I felt as comfortable jumping around the system as I am on the tube. It is safe and I found the staff to be very helpful. I must have walked 12 miles over two days with my sight seeing. There is lots to do / places to go. Just buy a guide book to get the tips and do the Freedom Trail to see the city by foot. Couple of things are poor (in my opinion) 1. Pool is absolutely tiny for a hotel of this size. I didn't bother using it for fear of hitting so many people whilst trying to swim! 2. American hotels are designed around the lifts. When you are on the 16th floor (fab views by the way) then the lifts get a little busy and frankly I'd rather walk down the stairs. The stairs are difficult to find and then when you reach ground level you end up in the back of the kitchen! I ended up walking down to level 4 and getting the lift the rest of the way! 3. Walls could be a little more insulating - on one occasion I was woken by next doors bed gymnastics. Boston is a great city and whilst this hotel is a little way out of the centre, the links are easy into town and the airport.
